quote: This performance was aided by the swift actions we took last year to narrow our strategic focus and play to our core strengths
source: David Solomon, CEO, Goldman Sachs May 2024 CNBC Interview, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Delivering exceptional performance and meeting ambitious targets
question: Tell me about a time when you set an ambitious target and had to rally your team to exceed expectations.
quote: We have met or exceeded almost all the performance targets that we set for ourselves
source: David Solomon, CEO, Goldman Sachs 2024 Annual Report, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Embracing technological change for long-term competitive advantage
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead a team through a significant technological transformation or innovation initiative.
quote: This will not be a quarter-to-quarter project but part of the investment bank's focus over the next five to 10 years
source: David Solomon, CEO, on AI transformation, Qz.com, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Protecting and building the firm's reputation through all actions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to choose between a quick win and protecting your organization's reputation.
quote: Our assets are our people, capital and reputation. If any of these is ever diminished, the last is the most difficult to restore
source: David Solomon, CEO, Goldman Sachs 2024 Annual Report, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Maintaining confidence in the future while navigating uncertainty
question: Tell me about a time when you had to inspire confidence in your team during a period of significant uncertainty or change.
quote: Whatever the future holds, I am very confident about the trajectory of Goldman Sachs
source: David Solomon, CEO, Goldman Sachs 2024 Annual Report, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Ensuring client success drives firm success
question: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond to ensure a client's success
question_type: even when it required extra effort from your team.
quote: Medium
source: If we serve our clients well, our own success will follow
column10: David Solomon, CEO, Goldman Sachs 2024 Annual Report, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Maintaining high standards while staying humble and open to learning
question: Tell me about a time when you had to admit you were wrong and change course while maintaining your team's confidence.
quote: I care about our culture, which is one of rigor and humility and partnership
source: Ted Pick, CEO, Bloomberg Interview, October 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Working collaboratively and building strong partnerships
question: Tell me about a time when you had to build a partnership with someone who initially disagreed with your approach.
quote: I care about our culture, which is one of rigor and humility and partnership
source: Ted Pick, CEO, Bloomberg Interview, October 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Delivering consistent strong performance across market cycles
question: Tell me about a time when you had to ensure your team delivered exceptional results during challenging market conditions.
quote: World-class execution demands that we deliver strong earnings and returns through the cycle
source: Ted Pick, CEO, Q2 2024 Earnings Call, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Building and growing client franchises while developing talent
question: Tell me about a time when you had to simultaneously grow a business while developing your team's capabilities.
quote: A strategic leader with a strong track record of building and growing our client franchise, developing and retaining talent
source: Tom Glocer, Lead Director, Morgan Stanley Press Release, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Demonstrating strong values and commitment to people and clients
question: Tell me about a time when your values were tested and how you remained committed to doing the right thing for your clients and team.
quote: His values, intellect, passion and commitment to our people and our clients
source: James Gorman, Former CEO, on Ted Pick, Morgan Stanley Press Release, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Working effectively across different regions and cultures
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead a project or initiative that required working across multiple countries or cultural contexts.
quote: Works very effectively not just in the U.S., but around the globe
source: James Gorman, Former CEO, on Ted Pick, Morgan Stanley Press Release, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Delivering consistent performance and maintaining reliability
question: Tell me about a time when you had to maintain consistent performance despite facing unexpected obstacles.
quote: I think the story of our earnings is one of consistency
source: Ted Pick, CEO, Q3 2024 Earnings Call, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Understanding and managing complex risks while making sound decisions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a critical decision involving significant risk and how you managed the potential downside.
quote: Battle-tested, understands complex risk
source: James Gorman, Former CEO, on Ted Pick, Morgan Stanley Press Release, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Positioning for long-term growth and identifying new opportunities
question: Tell me about a time when you identified and pursued a new growth opportunity that others initially overlooked.
quote: I am excited about the opportunities for future growth
source: Ted Pick, CEO, Morgan Stanley Press Release, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Demonstrating empathy and compassion in leadership decisions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision that required balancing business needs with genuine care for people affected.
quote: You know heart and soul when you see it in effect on sports teams or with 'the boys in the boat'—it's a beautiful thing to watch
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Being willing to work directly with teams and understand ground-level challenges
question: Tell me about a time when you had to dive deep into operational details to solve a problem or support your team.
quote: Have a heart and get in the trenches
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Following rigorous analysis while knowing when to act decisively
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance thorough analysis with the need to make a timely decision under pressure.
quote: Enforce a good decision-making process. Examine raw data and focus on real numbers
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2021

role: Leadership
principle_description: Facing facts honestly and remaining open to learning and improvement
question: Tell me about a time when you had to confront a difficult reality about your team's performance and lead them through necessary changes.
quote: Always deal with reality. Remain open to learning how to become a better leader
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2021

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Understanding that banking work has meaningful impact on communities and individuals
question: Tell me about a time when you helped someone achieve their goals and how it reinforced the importance of your work.
quote: I often remind our employees that the work we do matters and has impact
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Building trust and respect rather than relying on authority alone
question: Tell me about a time when you had to influence others without formal authority and build consensus around a difficult decision.
quote: Soft power – essentially trust and maturity – may become more important than hard power
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Articulating goals clearly to inspire team commitment
question: Tell me about a time when you had to communicate a complex vision or goal in a way that motivated others to follow.
quote: If you can communicate an intentional objective to staffers, they'll follow you anywhere
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Maintaining strong financial position to invest through all market cycles
question: Tell me about a time when you had to maintain conservative resource management while others were taking bigger risks.
quote: A fortress balance sheet that allows us to invest in good times and in bad times
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Consistently investing in technology and capabilities to serve customers better
question: Tell me about a time when you championed an investment in technology or capabilities that improved service delivery.
quote: Continuous investing in technology to better serve both our employees and our customers
source: Jamie Dimon, CEO, Annual Shareholder Letter, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Embracing change and modernization for future success
question: Tell me about a time when you had to adapt to or lead a significant change in processes or technology.
quote: Our vision is clear. The strategy is set. The pieces are in place
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, 2024 Annual Stockholders' Meeting, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Taking ownership of results and ensuring team accountability
question: Tell me about a time when you had to hold yourself or your team accountable for underperformance and drive improvement.
quote: Ensuring we have a culture characterized by excellence and accountability
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, Citi Annual Meeting, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Making leadership decisions that directly improve client experience
question: Tell me about a time when you restructured your approach or team to better serve clients and improve their experience.
quote: They are accountable for every aspect of the client experience
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, describing new leadership structure, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Moving faster and smarter in a competitive environment
question: Tell me about a time when you had to accelerate your team's decision-making process to capitalize on an opportunity.
quote: Our teams are more agile. We're moving faster and smarter
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, 2024 Annual Stockholders' Meeting, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Maintaining stability and performance during challenging times
question: Tell me about a time when you had to guide your team through a difficult period while maintaining confidence and performance.
quote: Citi was built for this. Our strategy has been designed to perform across a wide range of conditions
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, Citi Annual Meeting, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Leading environmental and social responsibility initiatives
question: Tell me about a time when you championed a sustainability or social responsibility initiative that required long-term commitment.
quote: On my first day as CEO, I committed Citi to net zero emissions by the year 2050
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, Citi Annual Meeting, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Setting higher expectations and improving execution
question: Tell me about a time when you had to raise performance standards and help others adapt to higher expectations.
quote: We've raised the bar on ourselves. We've redefined how we measure success
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, 2024 Annual Stockholders' Meeting, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Achieving measurable improvements in performance and efficiency
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative that delivered significant measurable improvements for your organization.
quote: Net income up nearly 40% to $12.7 billion
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, 2024 Annual Stockholders' Meeting, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Serving institutions with cross-border needs and global wealth management
question: Tell me about a time when you managed a complex cross-border project or served clients with international needs.
quote: To be the preeminent banking partner for institutions with cross border needs, a global leader in wealth
source: Jane Fraser, CEO, Citi Vision Statement, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Growing the business while maintaining strong risk principles and serving all stakeholders
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance growth opportunities with responsible risk management.
quote: Responsible growth is the strategy we've been following consistently since 2014
source: Brian Moynihan, CEO, Bank of America Communications, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Putting customer needs at the center of all strategic decisions
question: Tell me about a time when you changed your approach or strategy to better serve customer needs.
quote: Grow with a customer-focused strategy
source: Brian Moynihan, CEO, Bank of America Responsible Growth Principles, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Being a source of positive energy and calmness during pressure situations
question: Tell me about a time when you had to remain calm under pressure and energize your team to overcome a significant challenge.
quote: One thing that you look for in people and you try to be, is an energy giver, not an energy taker

role: Leadership
principle_description: Making decisions based on who will execute rather than just what the decision is
question: Tell me about a time when you had to carefully select the right person to lead a critical initiative and how you supported their success.
quote: Every decision we have to make as a leader, you have to think about who's going to do it, not what the decision is

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Taking a long-term view for the benefit of the organization beyond personal tenure
question: Tell me about a time when you made a decision that would benefit the organization long-term
question_type: even if it didn't benefit you immediately.
quote: Medium
source: The institution that we represent, and we're here a nanosecond in the life cycle of this company

role: Senior
principle_description: Using business success to solve societal problems and create positive impact
question: Tell me about a time when you found a way to achieve business objectives while also creating positive social or environmental impact.
quote: Capitalism is the only system that can solve the problems that the world needs

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Winning in the market through disciplined execution without making excuses
question: Tell me about a time when you faced obstacles but refused to make excuses and found a way to achieve your goals.
quote: Win in the market, no excuses
source: Brian Moynihan, CEO, Bank of America Responsible Growth Principles, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Successfully balancing financial performance with broader stakeholder value
question: Tell me about a time when you had to demonstrate that doing the right thing for stakeholders could also drive financial success.
quote: The 'genius of the AND' is we've both got to create money and do it the right way

role: Senior
principle_description: Maintaining disciplined expense management while investing in growth
question: Tell me about a time when you had to improve operational efficiency while still investing in capabilities or people.
quote: It requires good expense management, or operational excellence
source: Brian Moynihan, CEO, describing responsible growth, 2024KKR
column12: KKR emphasizes working together collaboratively across the organization to achieve better outcomes
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to collaborate with a diverse team to achieve a challenging goal. How did you ensure everyone contributed effectively?
column16: The firm wanted a physical manifestation of really the firm's value around collaboration, the ability to work together more collegiality.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: KKR's culture is built on learning from leaders and being mentored by innovative investors, with a focus on developing the next generation
question: Tell me about a time when you mentored someone junior to you while simultaneously learning from a senior leader. How did you balance both roles?
quote: We are fortunate to have learned from and been mentored and inspired by two of the world's most innovative investors of all time.
source: Joe Bae and Scott Nuttall, Co-CEO appointment announcement, 2021

role: Senior
principle_description: KKR focuses on building strategic holdings and long-term ownership rather than quick exits for sustainable value creation
question: Tell me about a time when you had to choose between a quick win and a long-term strategic opportunity. How did you make your decision and what was the outcome?
quote: KKR Co-Chief Executive Officers Joe Bae and Scott Nuttall are taking a cue from Berkshire Hathaway Inc.'s business model by betting big on long-term private equity ownership and the ensuing dividends.

role: Leadership
principle_description: KKR maintains a commitment to excellence across all levels of the organization with deeply held values
question: Tell me about a time when you had to maintain extremely high standards while facing significant pressure to compromise. How did you handle the situation?
quote: For nearly five decades, KKR has been fortifying companies and delivering for our investors. As the firm has evolved, our people and our culture have remained core to our commitment to excellence.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: KKR has successfully transformed from a traditional LBO firm to a diversified investment firm
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead or adapt to a significant change in strategy or approach. What challenges did you face and how did you overcome them?
quote: Bae, 52, and Nuttall, 51, in the three years since they ascended, and beforehand as co-COOs, have radically reshaped the machine that Henry and George built.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: KKR operates with a clear mission and ensures all team members understand and contribute to that mission
question: Tell me about a time when you had to align your personal values with an organization's mission. How did you contribute to achieving shared goals?
quote: Today, we are proud to celebrate those who have been promoted to the most senior levels of our firm as they exemplify our deeply held values, and our dedication to supporting our clients and portfolio companies.

role: Senior
principle_description: KKR considers responsibility to a wider range of stakeholders in decision-making
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance competing stakeholder interests. How did you ensure all parties felt heard while making the best decision for the organization?
quote: Today, more than ever, it is critical to consider our responsibility to a wider range of stakeholders in order to continue delivering on behalf of our clients and shareholders.
source: Joe Bae and Scott Nuttall, 2022 Sustainability Report

role: Leadership
principle_description: KKR sets bold targets and works systematically to achieve them
question: Tell me about a time when you set an ambitious goal that others thought was unrealistic. How did you develop a plan to achieve it and what was the result?
quote: KKR's co-CEOs want to double market cap and reach $1 trillion in assets under management by 2030.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Blackstone emphasizes pursuing worthy fantasies and great things, focusing energy on consequential goals
question: Tell me about a time when you chose to pursue a challenging, ambitious project over something easier. What made you believe it was worth the effort?
quote: I'm a great believer in what I call having a worthy fantasy. If you're going to do something, it ought to be a great thing, because there are only so many things you can do with your life.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Maintaining integrity is a non-negotiable principle at Blackstone regardless of circumstances
question: Tell me about a time when maintaining your integrity came at a personal or professional cost. How did you handle the situation?
quote: Always keep your integrity.

role: Senior
principle_description: Blackstone values leaders who speak out when they see something wrong and aren't afraid to challenge conventional thinking
question: Tell me about a time when you had to speak out against a popular opinion or decision you knew was wrong. What was your approach and what happened?
quote: When you see something that isn't right, speak out. Write something. Don't be scared. No one will ever encourage you to write anything that takes on the conventional opinion when you know you're right and convention is going the wrong way. You must be brave.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Blackstone believes in only using A-level talent for A-level jobs and maintaining extremely high hiring standards
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult staffing decision because someone wasn't meeting the standards required for success. How did you handle it?
quote: You learn over time that if you ask B-level talent to do an A-level job, they will fail every time. We're not creating semiconductors here; it's just finance. That means you can only rely on your A players, and nobody has that many.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Blackstone's philosophy is to pursue opportunities where you cannot lose rather than taking unnecessary risks
question: Tell me about a time when you identified and avoided a significant risk that others wanted to take. How did you analyze the situation and communicate your concerns?
quote: I don't like risk. I went to an office opening with the mayor of Miami one day, and he asked me, 'Why did you decide to take such a big risk on Miami?' I said, 'I didn't think it was a risk.'

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Blackstone maintains a culture where everyone is always learning and staying current with market developments
question: Tell me about a time when you had to quickly learn something new to stay relevant or contribute effectively. How did you approach the learning process?
quote: I think it's creating excitement. Everybody here is always learning. What's new? What's interesting? Where should we be? What should we avoid? In that sense, there is no stability—in a good way.

role: Senior
principle_description: Leaders at Blackstone are expected to work for the common good even when there are short-term costs
question: Tell me about a time when you made a decision that benefited the greater good but came at a short-term cost to yourself or your immediate team. What was your reasoning?
quote: I have always believed one's obligation is to work for the common good. To the extent you can help achieve this objective for other people, you have an obligation to do so even if there is a short-term cost. That's what being a leader is.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Blackstone emphasizes the importance of making deposits before making withdrawals - being prepared before acting
question: Tell me about a time when thorough preparation made the difference between success and failure. What specific steps did you take to prepare?
quote: Remember—you've got to make your deposits before you can make a withdrawal!
source: Stephen Schwarzman's high school track coach, quoted in 'What It Takes'

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Apollo believes the capacity to originate good assets is the key to success in their industry
question: Tell me about a time when you had to identify and secure a valuable opportunity that others had overlooked. What was your approach?
quote: In an industry where we believe the capacity to originate good assets is the key to success, Apollo is playing to win.
source: Marc Rowan, Apollo CEO, 2024 Investor Day

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Apollo takes a patient and creative approach to investing that considers all stakeholders
question: Tell me about a time when you had to develop a creative solution to a complex problem while balancing multiple stakeholder interests. What was your process?
quote: Apollo's approach is described as 'patient, creative, and knowledgeable approach to investing' that 'aligns our clients, businesses we invest in, our employees, and the communities we impact, to expand opportunity and achieve positive outcomes.'

role: Senior
principle_description: Apollo seeks to provide clients excess returns at every point along the risk-reward spectrum
question: Tell me about a time when you had to optimize performance across different risk levels simultaneously. How did you balance competing priorities?
quote: In Apollo's asset management business, they 'seek to provide our clients excess return at every point along the risk-reward spectrum from investment grade to private equity.'

role: Leadership
principle_description: Apollo maintains extremely high standards for origination activity and performance metrics
question: Tell me about a time when you exceeded ambitious performance targets. What strategies did you employ and how did you maintain momentum?
quote: Our fourth quarter results punctuate a very strong year of performance for Apollo. 2024 highlights include record origination activity exceeding $220 billion, inflows of more than $150 billion, and assets under management surpassing $750 billion.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Apollo recognizes and positions for the convergence of public and private markets
question: Tell me about a time when you anticipated a major industry trend and positioned yourself or your organization to capitalize on it. What was your reasoning?
quote: Two of the biggest trends we see in the next five years are the convergence of public and private markets, and the changing role of financial institutions.

role: Senior
principle_description: Apollo invests heavily in developing senior leadership and believes in being "rich for talent"
question: Tell me about a time when you identified and developed high-potential talent within your organization. What was your approach and what was the outcome?
quote: We are rich for talent at Apollo. These senior leadership appointments reflect that and will support our ongoing evolution as a next generation financial services firm.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Carlyle believes their greatest asset is their deep bench of talent across the organization
question: Tell me about a time when you contributed as part of a talented team where everyone brought unique strengths. How did you add value while learning from others?
quote: Carlyle's greatest asset is its deep bench of talent.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Carlyle maintains world-class investment standards and expects impressive track records from their leaders
question: Tell me about a time when you had to meet extremely high standards while leading an important project. How did you ensure quality while managing pressure?
quote: Steve is a world-class investor with an impressive track record leading one of our largest investment sectors for over a decade.

role: Senior
principle_description: Carlyle is dedicated to driving long-term value for multiple stakeholder groups
question: Tell me about a time when you had to create value for multiple stakeholder groups simultaneously. How did you balance competing interests and measure success?
quote: I'm dedicated to – and proud of – our mission to drive long-term value for our investors, companies, shareholders, people, and communities.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Carlyle's leadership is committed to initiatives focused on mental health and developing future business leaders
question: Tell me about a time when you supported someone's professional development while also addressing their well-being challenges. What was your approach?
quote: Beyond my role at Carlyle, I'm involved in investment and philanthropic initiatives focused on mental health and developing future business leaders, including women and young professionals pursuing careers in finance.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: TPG values leaders who remain calm and maintain clear communication during uncertain times
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead others through a period of significant uncertainty. How did you maintain team morale and effectiveness?
quote: From a leadership perspective, when you go through these periods of tremendous uncertainty, it's a certainty that if you're feeling nervous or off, pretty much everybody in your organization is feeling the same way. The key is to remain calm and ensure touch points across your organization.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: TPG understands the importance of concentrated relationships and being important to key partners
question: Tell me about a time when you had to build and maintain a strategic relationship that was critical to success. What was your approach to becoming a valued partner?
quote: The largest pools of capital want to do more with fewer managers. People want to concentrate and focus their relationships because they feel like they'll be important to their GPs [general partners] that way.

role: Senior
principle_description: TPG leadership recognizes market cycles and positions the firm to capitalize when confidence returns
question: Tell me about a time when you recognized a market opportunity during a downturn and positioned your organization to capitalize when conditions improved. What was your strategy?
quote: After a period of rising interest rates and lower transaction volumes in the corporate world, we're starting to see confidence come back – rates are not going to continuously go up. As confidence comes back to the market, you tend to see transactional volumes pick up.

role: Leadership
principle_description: TPG sees private capital playing an increasingly critical role in global capital provision
question: Tell me about a time when you anticipated a fundamental shift in your industry and positioned your organization for the future. How did you communicate this vision to stakeholders?
quote: The last decade has been hugely transformative in terms of how capital is getting to the most interesting companies in the world, and how those companies are being owned and governed. I don't see that changing – it ebbs and flows, but I only see it increasing in terms of the critical role that private capital will play.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: TPG maintains high levels of engagement with portfolio companies and management teams
question: Tell me about a time when you had to work closely with a partner or client to drive value creation. How did you balance being supportive while maintaining high standards?
quote: We always have a high level of engagement with our portfolio, both in terms of driving value creation, but also partnering with our CEOs, entrepreneur founders, and management teams.

role: Senior
principle_description: TPG emphasizes the importance of contact
question: communication
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you had to increase communication and transparency during a challenging period. What specific steps did you take and what was the impact?
quote: Leadership
column10: The key is to remain calm and ensure touch points across your organization, and really reinforce the level of contact, communication, and transparency.
column12: Entry Level
column13: Consumer-Centric Innovation
column14: Prioritizing innovation and brand building over promotional spending to serve consumers better
column15: Tell me about a time when you chose to invest in a long-term solution rather than a quick fix to better serve customers.
column18: We would rather invest $1 in innovation, or $1 in brand building any day of the week before we invest in promotion
column19: Jon Moeller, CEO, Consumer Analyst Group of New York (CAGNY) conference, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Ensuring products deliver noticeably superior performance to consumers on first use
question: Tell me about a time when you had to improve a product or service that wasn't meeting customer expectations.
quote: If you're going to be in categories where performance drives brand choice, you have to perform.

role: Senior
principle_description: Delivering strong results to both top and bottom line while maintaining strategic focus
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance competing priorities between short-term results and long-term strategic goals.
quote: The first objective was to commit ourselves to balance, to deliver to both the top and bottom lines.
source: Jon Moeller, CEO, P&G Investor Relations, 2022

role: Leadership
principle_description: Being driven by the pursuit of delighting consumers rather than being enamored by technology
question: Tell me about a time when you had to refocus a team on customer needs rather than getting caught up in internal processes or technology.
quote: Get enamored with the pursuit of delight for consumers and customers
source: Jon Moeller, CEO, MIT Crossroads Conference, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Developing long-term strategic partnerships rather than transactional relationships
question: Tell me about a time when you built a strategic partnership that created mutual value over the long term.
quote: I'm a big believer in strategic partnerships as opposed to transactional partnerships.
source: Jon Moeller, CEO, P&G Investor Relations, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Breaking down silos to create more efficient and effective organizations
question: Tell me about a time when you had to work across departments or functions to solve a complex problem.
quote: A siloed corporate model divided into different functions is an economic dinosaur
source: Jon Moeller, CEO, MIT Sloan Management Review, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Using compelling data to help teams move forward and make better decisions
question: Tell me about a time when you used data to convince others to change their approach or strategy.
quote: We needed very strong, compelling sets of data to help people move forward.
source: Jon Moeller, CEO, MIT Crossroads Conference, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Setting ambitious but achievable sustainability targets that deliver tangible short-term impact
question: Tell me about a time when you had to adjust expectations or goals to make them more realistic while maintaining high standards.
quote: Our updated commitments are very stretching, but they are also intentionally and unashamedly realistic.
source: Hein Schumacher, CEO, Unilever Sustainability Report, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Concentrating efforts and resources on areas where the company can make the biggest impact
question: Tell me about a time when you had to reallocate resources from multiple small initiatives to focus on fewer high-impact projects.
quote: We have learned from experience that we need to be more focused in our allocation of resources to make tangible progress on the big, complex challenges we face.
source: Hein Schumacher, CEO, Unilever Annual Report, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Making sustainability progress integral to business performance rather than separate initiatives
question: Tell me about a time when you successfully integrated social or environmental considerations into business decision-making.
quote: It's all about accelerating delivery, with greater impact, by making sustainability progress integral to business performance.
source: Hein Schumacher, CEO, Unilever Sustainability Report, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Applying purpose and sustainability where it creates genuine competitive advantage
question: Tell me about a time when you aligned a project or initiative with a larger purpose or mission to drive better results.
quote: I don't think we advance the cause of purpose by force-fitting it across every brand.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Converting knowledge and expertise into products that eliminate environmental impact
question: Tell me about a time when you used your knowledge or skills to create a positive impact on others or the environment.
quote: We'll continue to convert our strong know-how in this area into products that mitigate or, even better, eliminate environmental impact
source: Hein Schumacher, CEO, Unilever Innovation Report, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Prioritizing initiatives that deliver immediate tangible results while maintaining long-term vision
question: Tell me about a time when you had to deliver quick wins while building toward a longer-term goal.
quote: We have too many long-term commitments that failed to make sufficient short-term impact, and the latter is what the world really needs right now.
source: Hein Schumacher, CEO, Unilever Sustainability Report, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Staying physically present and connected with frontline employees during challenging times
question: Tell me about a time when you went out of your way to support your team during a difficult period.
quote: I'm not cheering you on from the safety of my home office—I'm actually here with you because I believe this factory is a safe place to work.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Using data as a game-changer to shift from traditional market research to real consumer insights
question: Tell me about a time when you used data or analytics to uncover insights that changed your approach to a project.
quote: Data is a gamechanger for the way how Nestlé innovates

role: Leadership
principle_description: Concentrating capital and resources on high-growth categories while maintaining disciplined investment
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make difficult decisions about where to focus limited resources for maximum impact.
quote: Focus capital spending on higher-growth categories of coffee, pet food, baby food and water
source: Mark Schneider, CEO, Nestlé Annual Report, 2017

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Ensuring no stone is left unturned when it comes to employee safety and well-being
question: Tell me about a time when you prioritized safety or well-being over convenience or speed.
quote: No stone unturned if we sent hundreds and thousands of people to work every day.

role: Senior
principle_description: Creating products that offer better nutrition and environmental footprint while maintaining taste
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance multiple competing requirements to create an optimal solution.
quote: We are providing plant-based alternatives that taste the same, offer better nutritionals, and have a much better environmental footprint.
source: Mark Schneider, CEO, Nestlé Sustainability Report, 2022

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Bringing new products to market faster through improved innovation processes
question: Tell me about a time when you had to accelerate a timeline while maintaining quality standards.
quote: He has supported the company's innovation efforts to bring new products even faster to market.
source: Mark Schneider, CEO, Nestlé Innovation Report, 2023

role: Leadership
principle_description: Building the business for the next century rather than focusing on quarterly results
question: Tell me about a time when you advocated for a long-term strategy that required sacrificing short-term gains.

role: Senior
principle_description: Making decisions based on clear company values and purpose rather than just financial considerations
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision based on your values or principles.
quote: You have to be clear on what the company stands for, what is its purpose, what are the core values and what is central to you.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Making bold decisions to discontinue underperforming products and focus on growth areas

source: James Quincey, CEO, Coca-Cola Annual Report, 2021

role: Senior
principle_description: Working with competitors and peers to create larger-scale positive impact

quote: How can we share and set best practices around the world in competitive areas? Only through acting with our peer retailers we can truly make an impact on scale.
source: James Quincey, Co-chair, Consumer Goods Forum, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Standing firm on diversity principles as core company values
question: Tell me about a time when you advocated for diversity or inclusion in your workplace or community.
quote: We are one of the most diverse companies in America and we will continue to stand for those principles

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Moving away from over-cautiousness to embrace calculated risk-taking for growth
question: Tell me about a time when you took a calculated risk that led to a positive outcome.
quote: Quincey wanted to rid the Coke company's culture of over-cautiousness concerning risk
source: James Quincey, CEO, Business Strategy Analysis, 2022

role: Leadership
principle_description: Making transformative rather than incremental changes to drive significant impact
question: Tell me about a time when you led a major transformation or change initiative.
quote: Big changes to big things
source: Ramon Laguarta, CEO, World Economic Forum, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Empowering local leaders to make end-to-end decisions for their markets
question: Tell me about a time when you empowered others to make important decisions and take ownership of results.
quote: We need to win in 200 markets with empowered general managers who think end-to-end about how to optimize the cost structure, the portfolio, the talent base for each market.
source: Ramon Laguarta, CEO, PepsiCo Investor Relations, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Building organizational culture based on transparency
question: trust
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you built trust with colleagues or stakeholders through transparent communication.

column10: I like transparency. I like trust. I like empowerment.
column11: Ramon Laguarta, CEO, PepsiCo Leadership Interview, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Taking leadership position in sustainability even when it involves additional costs

quote: I think we need a leader, we need companies that want to take a leadership position and take an additional cost to their PnL
source: Ramon Laguarta, CEO, First Mover Coalition, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Creating smiles and positive impact while delivering strong business results

source: Ramon Laguarta, CEO, PepsiCo Mission Statement, 2022

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Inspiring teams to take bigger risks and reach company potential

quote: You can inspire people to make big changes to big things, take bigger risks, and reach the potential of the company
source: Ramon Laguarta, CEO, PepsiCo Leadership Forum, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Leading with authenticity as the foundation of trust and credibility

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Providing clarity and certainty to teams especially during uncertain times
question: Tell me about a time when you had to communicate complex or difficult information clearly to your team.
quote: The second is clarity. It is particularly important now because so many people want certainty.
source: Jeff Harmening, CEO, Consumer Goods Technology, 2020

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Bringing people together to accomplish what none could accomplish individually
question: Tell me about a time when you worked as part of a team to achieve something bigger than what any individual could do alone.

source: Jeff Harmening, CEO, Consumer Brands Association, 2020

role: Senior
question: community
question_type: and consumers as the path to shareholder success
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you balanced the needs of multiple stakeholders to achieve the best overall outcome.

column10: When you take care of your employees, when you take care of your community, when you look after each other and when you serve your consumers, your shareholders also win.
column11: Jeff Harmening, CEO, General Mills Leadership, 2021

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Embracing change and adaptation as essential for long-term survival and growth
question: Tell me about a time when you had to adapt quickly to unexpected changes or challenges.
quote: We've been around for nearly 160 years and have become a $20 billion company precisely because we have been willing to change.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Using challenging times to reveal and strengthen organizational character
question: Tell me about a time when you led through a crisis and what it revealed about your values or capabilities.
quote: Challenging times don't always create character, but I do think they reveal it.

role: Entry Level
question: trustworthy brands that consumers can count on

quote: Easy
source: In a world where so much is changing, people yearn for something they can count on, and for us, it's our brands they know and trust.
column10: Jeff Harmening, CEO, General Mills Annual Report, 2022

role: Senior
principle_description: Becoming more consumer-obsessed to predict and meet evolving consumer behavior
question: Tell me about a time when you shifted focus to better understand and serve customer needs.
quote: We need to become more consumer obsessed so we can better predict their behavior even before they know it.
source: Miguel Patricio, CEO, Seeking Alpha Transcript, 2020

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Prioritizing sustainable growth strategy over pure bottom-line focus
question: Tell me about a time when you prioritized long-term growth over short-term cost savings.
quote: Maybe in the past, we were too focused on the bottom line. We need a strategy, first of all for growth, which is critical.
source: Miguel Patricio, CEO, Food Navigator Interview, 2019

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Taking responsibility to be part of the solution for systemic inequality
question: Tell me about a time when you took action to promote diversity or address inequality in your environment.
quote: We demand diversity. We live in a world where systemic racism and inequality exists. And writing these wrongs requires an equally systemic response from everyone
source: Miguel Patricio, CEO, Kraft Heinz Values Statement, 2020

role: Leadership
principle_description: Viewing periods of transformation as opportunities for growth and improvement
question: Tell me about a time when you turned a challenging situation into an opportunity for positive change.
quote: Where there is transformation, there is opportunity.
source: Miguel Patricio, CEO, Kraft Heinz Leadership, 2021

role: Senior
principle_description: Maintaining disciplined focus on executing strategic priorities with excellence

source: Carlos Abrams-Rivera, CEO, Kraft Heinz Earnings Call, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Developing multiple contingency plans to navigate uncertain business environments
question: Tell me about a time when having backup plans helped you successfully navigate an unexpected challenge.
quote: It's important not only to have plan A, but have plan A, B and C

role: Senior
principle_description: Committing fully to new directions without looking back to old ways of operating
question: Tell me about a time when you had to commit completely to a new approach and leave old methods behind.
quote: We have to go in this new direction. And what we're going to do is we're going to basically cross this bridge and burn the bridge behind us
source: Carlos Abrams-Rivera, CEO, Fortune Interview, 2024Johnson & Johnson
column12: Primary responsibility to patients doctors nurses mothers fathers and all others who use our products and services
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to prioritize a patient or customer need over what would have been easier or more profitable for you or your organization.
column16: We believe our first responsibility is to the patients, doctors and nurses, to mothers and fathers and all others who use our products and services.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Maintaining position as innovation powerhouse through significant R&D investment
question: Tell me about a time when you had to advocate for investing additional resources or time into research or development even when the outcome was uncertain.

role: Senior
principle_description: Everything we do must be of high quality to meet patient needs

quote: In meeting their needs everything we do must be of high quality.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Using 80-year-old Credo principles to guide major business decisions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision using company values or principles as your guide even when it meant short-term challenges.
quote: We do it with conviction. Conviction on the principles of our credo, that, by the way, this year is the 80th anniversary of the credo was written.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Seeking diverse viewpoints as necessary for balanced decision-making
question: Tell me about a time when you actively sought out diverse perspectives to solve a complex problem and how those different viewpoints influenced your final decision.
quote: his approach to business is shaped by the idea that our points of difference are often our greatest strengths. So whenever he's advising a colleague or a team, Duato makes it a priority to seek diverse perspectives, which he understands are necessary for balanced decision-making.
source: Article about Joaquin Duato CEO Leadership Philosophy 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Taking responsibility when mistakes are made and standing by products when science supports them
question: Tell me about a time when you or your team made a mistake and how you took responsibility for addressing it.
quote: When we make a mistake, we take responsibility. And when the facts, the science, and the law are on our side, we stand by our products.

role: Senior
principle_description: Encouraging employees to be tech bilingual to accelerate healthcare innovation
question: Tell me about a time when you had to learn and integrate new technology or tools to improve your work effectiveness or solve a challenging problem.
quote: He encourages employees across the organization to be tech bilingual—combining their fluency in science, biology or business with fluency in technology—to accelerate and simplify healthcare innovation.
source: Article about Joaquin Duato CEO Leadership Philosophy 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Making breakthrough decisions even in the face of uncertainty or adversity
question: Tell me about a time when you had to take a significant risk or make an important decision despite having incomplete information.
quote: Breakthroughs start by challenging convention, especially in the face of uncertainty or adversity. This happens when we think big, speak up, and are decisive.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Performing at our best together to change patients' lives
question: Tell me about a time when you had to work with others to achieve a standard of excellence that none of you could have reached individually.
quote: We can only change patients' lives when we perform at our best together. This happens when we focus on what matters, agree who does what, and measure our outcomes.

role: Senior
principle_description: Acting to reduce healthcare disparities and ensure every person deserves to be seen heard and cared for
question: Tell me about a time when you identified and took action to address an inequity or ensure someone was included who might otherwise have been overlooked.
quote: We believe that every person deserves to be seen, heard, and cared for. This happens when we are inclusive, act with integrity, and reduce healthcare disparities.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Finding fulfillment and pride in work that gives back to us
question: Tell me about a time when you helped create a positive work environment or celebrated achievements in a way that brought meaning and fulfillment to your team.
quote: We give ourselves to our work, but it also gives to us. We find joy when we take pride, recognize one another, and have fun.

role: Senior
principle_description: Trusting people to aim high and achieve breakthrough results
question: Tell me about a time when you empowered someone on your team to pursue an ambitious goal and how you supported them through the process.
quote: If you aim high, you will achieve things that you never thought possible. And, if you trust people and allow them to aim high, they will achieve for you things that you wouldn't even dream.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Being driven by principles and doing the right things that people will never forget
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead or participate in a significant change initiative and how you maintained focus on core values throughout the process.
quote: companies and organizations that treat people well can excel and make a memorable impact. If you are driven by principles, and you do the right things, this is something that people will never forget.
source: Albert Bourla CEO Pfizer Leadership Philosophy 2024

principle_description: Treating over 1.3 billion patients annually with unwavering commitment to innovation

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Expanding and enabling equitable access to medicines for hundreds of millions who depend on us

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Putting patients first and raising the bar on scientific excellence

role: Senior
principle_description: Working with speed and urgency to save and improve lives around the world

principle_description: Remaining optimistic about driving tomorrow's innovations through continued investment

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Discussing solutions to ensure medicines are broadly accessible and affordable

question: Tell me about a time when you used data analysis or new technology to solve a problem or improve a process in an innovative way.
quote: We're also starting to understand biology differently as data and new digital approaches like AI and machine learning are being applied in research, and I believe we could be at an inflection point in the advancement of global health.

principle_description: Delivering strong growth reflecting demand for innovative portfolio

quote: We delivered strong growth in 2024, reflecting demand for our innovative portfolio, including for KEYTRUDA, which continues to benefit more patients with cancer globally.

principle_description: Continuously reimagining the standard of care for challenging healthcare conditions

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Finding meaning and fulfillment in work that empowers people to be their best every day
question: Tell me about a time when you found deep personal motivation in your work and how that inspiration influenced your performance or impact on others.

source: Novartis Culture Values Inspired Curious Unbossed 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Maintaining a constant desire to learn that fuels innovative medicines and breakthrough solutions

principle_description: Empowering people to shape their work environment and pursue their ideas for maximum creativity

principle_description: Reimagining Novartis as a medicines and data science company
question: Tell me about a time when you leveraged data or technology to pioneer a new approach or solution in your field.
quote: reimagine Novartis as a 'medicines and data science' company.

principle_description: Never losing sense of wonder at how human ingenuity leads to longer healthier lives

quote: I never lose my sense of wonder at how human ingenuity is leading to longer, healthier lives.

principle_description: Discovering and developing breakthrough treatments for as many people as possible
question: Tell me about a time when you went out of your way to ensure your work or solution would benefit the maximum number of people possible.

principle_description: Ensuring patients and families are part of dialogue and decision-making with active voice
question: Tell me about a time when you made sure to include the voice of those most affected by a decision in your planning or problem-solving process.

principle_description: Being passionate about transforming patients' lives

principle_description: Believing that good business means a better world

principle_description: Seeking answers through experiments and data
question: Tell me about a time when you used data and evidence to guide an important decision rather than relying on assumptions or opinions.

question: Tell me about a time when you actively sought out or embraced different perspectives and how that diversity of thought led to a better outcome.

principle_description: Delivering remarkable impact felt within healthcare and beyond

principle_description: Making decisions based on deep caring and compassion for people
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision and how you ensured compassion and care for people affected guided your choice.

principle_description: Innovating relentlessly in everything we do to tackle unmet needs

principle_description: Pursuing highest standards in quality compliance safety and performance with integrity at heart
question: Tell me about a time when you had to uphold high ethical standards or integrity even when it was difficult or costly to do so.

principle_description: Embracing diverse backgrounds and perspectives to achieve collective best
question: Tell me about a time when you worked to create a more inclusive environment and how that inclusion led to better team performance.

principle_description: Weighing all decisions against common good for enterprise and solving problems for all

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Always striving to do the right thing in all situations
question: Tell me about a time when you chose to do what was right even though it might have been more challenging than other available options.

principle_description: Keeping patients at the heart of everything we do

quote: Their global employees keep patients at the heart of everything they do.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Being motivated by the power of science to transform lives
question: Tell me about a time when your enthusiasm for learning or scientific thinking helped you solve a complex problem or drive innovation.
quote: They are motivated by the power of science.

role: Senior
principle_description: Pushing boundaries of science and technology for unmet medical needs
question: Tell me about a time when you pushed beyond conventional approaches to develop a breakthrough solution for a challenging problem.
quote: They are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of science and technology to develop breakthrough treatments for unmet medical needs.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Transforming lives through science with inclusive leadership
question: Tell me about a time when you led a transformational change that improved outcomes for the people you serve while fostering an inclusive environment.
quote: Their vision is to be a global biopharmaceutical leader, transforming patients' lives through science.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Owning success and striving to be transparent in delivering commitments

role: Senior
principle_description: Creating positive inclusive environment where employees thrive
question: Tell me about a time when you actively worked to create a more inclusive environment and the specific actions you took to ensure everyone felt they belonged.
quote: Their culture is essential to creating a positive, inclusive environment where employees thrive.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Believing the priceless ingredient of every product is the integrity of its maker
question: Tell me about a time when you ensured the highest quality or ethical standards in your work even when no one was watching.

column12: Building diverse teams that listen and incorporate different perspectives
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to lead a team with diverse viewpoints and needed to ensure everyone's voice was heard before making an important decision.
column16: You don't do that very well by digging in and having one position you're sure is right and not wanting to listen to others. You do that by being inclusive.
column17: Joe Ucuzoglu, Global CEO, Duke Fuqua School Interview, 2020

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Balancing shareholder returns with broader societal impact and long-term thinking
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision that balanced immediate business results with longer-term stakeholder interests including community impact.
quote: When one maintains a long-term view, taking good care of stakeholders—employees, customers, suppliers, local communities, and society at large—converges with the objective of driving premium returns for shareholders as well.
source: Joe Ucuzoglu, Global CEO, Fortune Leadership Next Podcast, 2020

role: Senior
principle_description: Being open about challenges and areas needing improvement while maintaining trust
question: Tell me about a time when you had to be transparent about significant shortcomings or failures in your organization while maintaining stakeholder confidence.
quote: There are a lot of things where we're nowhere where we need to be, in terms of representation. So, we put all of that out there with an expectation that it would be met with a response of appreciation, as opposed to a response of critique.
source: Joe Ucuzoglu, Global CEO, DEI Transparency Report Discussion, 2021

role: Leadership
principle_description: Speaking up for organizational values and driving positive societal change
question: Tell me about a time when you took a stand on an important social issue that aligned with your organization's values despite potential business risks.
quote: Our people want to know that they work for an organization that's willing to visibly stand up for our values and speak out in favor of those societal changes that are near and dear to us.
source: Joe Ucuzoglu, Global CEO, Corporate Activism Discussion, 2020

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Emphasizing resilience and adaptability in a changing world
question: Tell me about a time when you had to quickly learn new skills or adapt to significant changes in your work environment.
quote: At Deloitte, we are committed to developing a workforce that's diverse, talented, technically skilled, resilient, and ready for continuous learning at a pace that matches the ever-changing needs of our world.
source: Joe Ucuzoglu, Global CEO, Hunter College Address, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Delivering highest quality advice through diverse inclusive teams
question: Tell me about a time when you assembled a diverse team to solve a complex client problem and how the team's diversity contributed to the solution.
quote: You want to promote that kind of culture within your organization, to get the best out of people, to build diverse inclusive teams that in our case are ultimately going to deliver the very best, highest quality advice to clients.
source: Joe Ucuzoglu, Global CEO, Notre Dame Center for Ethical Leadership, 2021

role: Senior
principle_description: Ensuring technology-driven growth includes all communities
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative to ensure that technological advancement or business growth benefited underrepresented communities.
quote: We, the business community, have an obligation to help make certain that this prosperity is inclusive, that we're focused on upskilling, retraining—making certain that all communities participate equitably in a tech-driven future.
source: Joe Ucuzoglu, Global CEO, Stakeholder Capitalism Discussion, 2021

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Creating positive stress and driving change rather than accepting current state
question: Tell me about a time when you identified a process or approach that wasn't working and took initiative to challenge and improve it.
quote: You can't accept status quo. You've got to create some stress... You have to learn to not only listen, but act upon what you're hearing. You have to do things differently.
source: Bob Moritz, Global Chairman, World Economic Forum Podcast, 2020

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Moving beyond hearing feedback to implementing meaningful change

quote: You have to learn to not only listen, but act upon what you're hearing. You have to do things differently.
source: Bob Moritz, Global Chairman, World Economic Forum Podcast, 2020

role: Senior
principle_description: Identifying controllable challenges and maximizing influence
question: Tell me about a time when you were faced with multiple competing priorities and had to determine where you could have the greatest impact.

source: Bob Moritz, Global Chairman, Business Today Interview, 2023

role: Leadership
principle_description: Using business as a force for solving important societal problems
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative that addressed a significant societal challenge while achieving business objectives.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Building trust through responsible AI deployment and customer data protection
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance innovation with ethical considerations or customer privacy concerns.
quote: Understanding the role of AI and being responsible in the deployment of AI... both of those things when you get it right, can expand revenue. And when it's wrong, it can really erode value pretty quickly.
source: Wes Bricker, US Vice Chair, CFO Dive Interview, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Prioritizing learning as a core organizational value

quote: I'm grateful to be part of a firm like PwC, where our senior leaders prioritize continuous learning as a core value.
source: Wes Bricker, US Vice Chair, Fairfield University Forum, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Recognizing that success comes through collaboration and intense curiosity
question: Tell me about a time when you achieved a significant result through collaboration that you couldn't have accomplished alone.
quote: This is a team sport. The only way I got there was spending time with other people. I had to be intensely curious about the world, because the world is never static.
source: Wes Bricker, US Vice Chair, Career Reflection, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Leading with clear purpose and strategy to guide teams
question: Tell me about a time when you had to align a team around a common purpose and strategy to achieve a challenging goal.
quote: Today's leaders need to have a purpose and a strategy to ensure their teams know what the organization is trying to accomplish.
source: Carmine Di Sibio, Global Chairman, World Economic Forum Interview, 2021

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Expressing empathy and transparency while maintaining confidence
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead through a crisis while being both vulnerable and confident with your team.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Creating environments where daily learning is expected and valued

quote: If you're at your job and you're not learning, you should change your job.
source: Carmine Di Sibio, Global Chairman, Leadership Philosophy, 2021

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Understanding that effective management requires listening and motivating employees

quote: To be an effective manager today, you have to know how to motivate - and how to listen to your employees and your people.
source: Carmine Di Sibio, Global Chairman, Meet the Leader Podcast, 2021

role: Senior
principle_description: Taking leadership responsibility to address societal gaps and challenges
question: Tell me about a time when you identified a social issue and took concrete action to address it through your professional role.
quote: I do think leaders have to step up here. Business leaders have a responsibility to society.
source: Carmine Di Sibio, Global Chairman, COVID Crisis Leadership, 2020

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Focusing on serving people rather than managing them
question: Tell me about a time when you approached a leadership challenge by focusing on serving your team's needs rather than directing their actions.
quote: I have seen the power of steward leadership and what happens when you bring out the very best in others... not managing people but really serving people and being in service to the people in their care.
source: Kelly Grier, US Chair, Values-Driven Leadership, 2020

role: Leadership
principle_description: Using corporate platforms to drive enduring social change
question: Tell me about a time when you took a strong public stance on a social justice issue and ensured it led to sustainable organizational change.

source: Kelly Grier, US Chair, Racial Justice Response, 2020

role: Senior
principle_description: Transforming challenges into opportunities through adaptability
question: Tell me about a time when you faced a significant setback and were able to transform it into a growth opportunity.
quote: Your greatest challenges are often your greatest opportunities in disguise... the ability to be both agile and to adapt to change quickly.
source: Kelly Grier, US Chair, Providence Business School, 2022

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Leading by example in allyship before expecting others to follow

quote: Leaders can't ask others to be allies to underrepresented groups until they are allies themselves... leaders should go beyond words and statements to make sure actionable, sustainable commitment starts with the leader.
source: Kelly Grier, US Chair, Allyship Discussion, 2021

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Ensuring all actions align with organizational values and quality standards
question: Tell me about a time when you had to maintain high quality standards while facing pressure to cut corners or compromise values.

source: Paul Knopp, US CEO, LinkedIn Profile, 2022

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Leading teams with integrity and excellence to build stakeholder trust

quote: We succeeded as one firm, composed of many great teams delivering the highest quality services to our clients... building trust with stakeholders, leading inclusive teams, and serving our clients with integrity and excellence.
source: Paul Knopp, US CEO, Leadership Reflection, 2025

role: Senior
principle_description: Viewing diversity and inclusion as essential for future business success

quote: You have to ensure you have the talent you need to be successful as a business in the future. So that's the way we've been looking at DEI, that it's still a business imperative.
source: Paul Knopp, US CEO, DEI Business Case, 2023

role: Leadership
principle_description: Being honest about progress while maintaining commitment to improvement

principle_description: Investing in future leaders from diverse communities

role: Mid Level

question_type: Tell me about a time when you had to model the behavior change you wanted to see in your organization.

source: The leader's job is not only to foster positive change in an organization but to model the kind of confident, trusting mindset that makes change possible.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Obsessing with speed to outpace changing world and competition
question: Tell me about a time when you had to deliver results faster than normal timelines and what strategies you used to maintain quality while increasing speed.
quote: When you hear 'future of defense,' what comes to mind? Speed. I'm obsessed with speed. The pace at which the world is changing, the pace at which our adversaries are changing — we need to be faster than them.
source: Scott McDonald, CEO, Defense Technology Discussion, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Balancing investment in current needs with future technology development
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance immediate operational needs with long-term innovation investments.
quote: We have a three-timeframe problem, which is that, at the same time, we're investing in the technologies of the Cold War, the technologies of today and the technologies of the future.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Making business decisions that benefit shareholders while addressing climate challenges
question: Tell me about a time when you championed an environmental initiative by demonstrating its business value.
quote: If we do more work around climate change, are we able to attract better people, can we do more work with clients, and do we make our shareholders happier? My own view on the answers to those questions is yes, yes, and yes.
source: Scott McDonald, CEO, Fletcher Forum Interview, 2017

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Using listening as a fundamental leadership tool to avoid organizational problems
question: Tell me about a time when active listening helped you identify and solve a problem that others had missed.
quote: The power of listening cannot be underestimated. It is very easy, the more senior you become, to stop listening to your clients, your people. But that's how organizations get in trouble. When you stop listening, as far as I'm concerned, it's over.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Distinguishing between scoring points and accomplishing meaningful goals the right way
question: Tell me about a time when you chose to pursue success over a quick win and explain how you defined success for that situation.
quote: There is a difference between winning and succeeding. Winning is simply scoring more points, but succeeding is accomplishing something and doing it the right way.

quote: We bring a private sector perspective and private sector innovation and private sector speed and flexibility that the government doesn't have... private sector innovation is necessary to a well-functioning government.

role: Leadership

question: Tell me about a time when you led a significant organizational transformation that required changing fundamental business approaches.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Listening well and understanding trade-offs to deliver superior service

role: Senior
principle_description: Maintaining high threshold for justification in major business decisions

principle_description: Investing in people's growth as the best way to attract and retain top talent

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Holding steady when others want fast answers in challenging situations

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Understanding that leadership involves choosing between different risks and living with consequences
question: Tell me about a time when you had to choose between two imperfect options and take responsibility for the outcome.
quote: Leadership is rarely about right vs. wrong. It's about risk vs. risk, and living with the consequences
source: Scott Bok, Former CEO, LinkedIn Post, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Succeeding in an unforgiving and fiercely competitive environment
question: Tell me about a time when you had to perform at your best in a highly competitive situation where failure was not an option.
quote: Wall Street is unforgiving. Firms rise. Others disappear. And very few leaders get to walk away at the top. It's fiercely competitive
source: Scott Bok, Former CEO, Industry Interview, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Leading effectively through multiple different types of major crises
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead your team through an unexpected crisis or major challenge.
quote: In just a few decades at Greenhill, we faced five major crises, each one different in cause, scope, and impact
source: Scott Bok, Former CEO, Corporate Communications, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Building and maintaining relationships that value independent-minded insights
question: Tell me about a time when you maintained a professional relationship despite initial disagreement or conflict.
quote: Greenhill seeks to build long term relationships with its clients, who value the independent-minded insights and perspectives of its team
source: Greenhill Corporate Description, Scott Bok Era, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Providing dedicated conflict-free and client-focused advice
question: Tell me about a time when you had to navigate competing interests to provide objective advice or recommendations.
quote: dedicated to providing conflict-free and client-focused advice
source: Greenhill Corporate Description, Scott Bok Era, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Addressing the vacuum of trust between clients and large Wall Street firms
question: Tell me about a time when you had to rebuild trust in a situation where confidence had been broken.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Ensuring that stated principles align with how success and revenue are actually rewarded

quote: failure to meet up to stated principles as one of Wall Street's biggest failures, citing firms that claim integrity as a company principle yet continue to reward producers who achieve revenue through unscrupulous means
source: Peter Weinberg, Founding Partner, Wharton Leadership Lecture, 2011

role: Senior
principle_description: Recognizing succession planning as one of the CEO's top responsibilities

role: Leadership
principle_description: Maintaining intimate culture and inclusivity while expanding the organization

principle_description: Focusing on building and developing long-term relationships as a cornerstone of success

question: Tell me about a time when you had to develop a creative solution to a complex problem that others couldn't solve.

column12: GA's culture emphasizes meaningful collaboration to serve capital partners and portfolio companies
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to collaborate across different teams or departments to achieve a common goal that seemed challenging at first.

column17: Bill Ford, Chairman and CEO, General Atlantic, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: GA partners directly with visionary entrepreneurs to scale their businesses
question: Tell me about a time when you identified an opportunity to support someone else's vision and helped them achieve breakthrough results.

role: Senior
principle_description: GA invests significantly in emerging markets to support global entrepreneurship
question: Tell me about a time when you had to navigate cultural differences or work across geographic boundaries to drive a successful outcome.
