I am honored to join the board of EMPEA and collaborate across its network to support the work of entrepreneurs advancing technological enablement, innovation, and positive impact within and beyond their communities."
source: Bill Ford, Chairman and CEO, EMPEA Board Announcement, 2020

role: Leadership
principle_description: GA has broadened its investing platform to include multiple strategies while maintaining core culture
question: Tell me about a time when you led an organization through significant strategic expansion while preserving its core values and culture.
quote: "General Atlantic's commitment to investment excellence and culture of partnership has enabled our firm to scale. Building on our 43-year history... we have broadened our platform in recent years to include Credit and Climate, two areas where we see significant growth opportunities."
source: Bill Ford, Chairman and CEO, General Atlantic, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: GA prioritizes investments that advance net zero and deliver measurable impact
question: Tell me about a time when you championed a project or initiative that balanced financial performance with environmental or social impact.
quote: "At General Atlantic, we recognize that addressing global climate change requires a multi-decade transformation of the global economy backed by significant investment. We believe that growth investing can help lead the carbon transition by harnessing the technology and innovation we see entrepreneurs driving around the world."
source: Bill Ford, Chairman and CEO, LinkedIn Post, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: GA focuses on building enduring partnerships that create sustainable value over time
question: Tell me about a time when you chose a long-term strategic approach over short-term gains, and how you convinced others to support that decision.
quote: "General Atlantic strives to support its leadership teams through any economic environment – noting the importance of value-add capabilities and long-term partnership in positioning for meaningful growth."
source: Bill Ford, Chairman and CEO, Globes Interview, 2022

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Vista uses systematic approaches to identify and develop the best talent regardless of background

principle_description: Vista has a well-defined systematic approach to growing companies after acquisition

principle_description: Vista believes in creating meritocracy through expanded opportunity sets

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Vista emphasizes making a difference in the communities where the firm operates
question: Tell me about a time when you took initiative to make a positive impact in your community or workplace beyond your core responsibilities.
quote: "Finding ways to make a difference in the communities where he lives and works is central to his character."
source: Robert Smith Biography, Vista Equity Partners, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Silver Lake specializes in partnering with premier technology management teams
question: Tell me about a time when you had to quickly learn about a new technology or technical domain to effectively support a project or team.
quote: "We are focused on growing Silver Lake's platform of global technology investing, positioning us to partner with the world's premier management teams to leverage our deep domain expertise, tap extensive industry relationships and drive innovation to achieve long-term investment success."
source: Egon Durban and Greg Mondre, Co-CEOs, Silver Lake, 2019

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Silver Lake builds winning relationships based on deep engagement and trust through multiple cycles
question: Tell me about a time when you built a strong working relationship with someone during a challenging period that led to long-term success.
quote: "The truly special management teams we are so fortunate work with – the world's best – with whom we have cultivated successful and winning relationships based on deep engagement and trust through multiple cycles of technology investing at scale."
source: Egon Durban and Greg Mondre, Co-CEOs, Silver Lake, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Silver Lake drives innovation to achieve long-term investment success at scale
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative to scale a technology solution or innovation that had significant organizational impact.
quote: "We leverage our deep domain expertise, tap extensive industry relationships and drive innovation to achieve long-term investment success."
source: Egon Durban and Greg Mondre, Co-CEOs, Silver Lake, 2019

role: Leadership
principle_description: Silver Lake maintains successful relationships across multiple technology investment cycles
question: Tell me about a time when you demonstrated consistency and excellence across multiple projects or business cycles, adapting your approach while maintaining core principles.
quote: "We have cultivated successful and winning relationships based on deep engagement and trust through multiple cycles of technology investing at scale."
source: Egon Durban and Greg Mondre, Co-CEOs, Silver Lake, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Silver Lake builds deep investor confidence through consistent performance
question: Tell me about a time when you had to rebuild or maintain confidence from stakeholders during a period of uncertainty.
quote: "We are deeply grateful to each of our investors, new and returning, for the confidence they place in Silver Lake."
source: Egon Durban and Greg Mondre, Co-CEOs, Silver Lake, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: TB's culture is built on mentor-mentee relationships and continuous learning
question: Tell me about a time when you sought out mentorship or guidance to develop a new skill, and how you applied what you learned.
quote: "Our culture and origin story are centered on the values of mentorship, entrepreneurship and empowerment. Founded on a mentor-mentee relationship between Carl Thoma and Orlando Bravo, the firm prides itself on continuously fostering the talents of junior members."
source: Orlando Bravo, Founder and Managing Partner, Thoma Bravo, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: TB approaches business challenges with creativity and views all problems as solvable
question: Tell me about a time when you faced a complex business problem and had to think creatively to find a solution.
quote: "If things were a straight line and always pretty steady, it would be so boring. We're here to solve challenges and get creative. Remember, every business problem can be solved... As long as you have willing partners, it can just be fixed."
source: Orlando Bravo, Founder and Managing Partner, Thoma Bravo, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: TB gives talented people real responsibility and opportunities to exceed expectations
question: Tell me about a time when you were given significant responsibility early in your career and how you rose to meet or exceed expectations.
quote: "I've found that when you give talented people real responsibility and a chance to prove themselves, they usually exceed expectations. This is why Thoma Bravo keeps the investment team relatively small to give even our newest Associates ample opportunity to step up and contribute meaningfully."
source: Orlando Bravo, Founder and Managing Partner, Thoma Bravo, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: TB focuses deeply on understanding leadership teams and what drives them
question: Tell me about a time when you had to deeply understand what motivated different stakeholders and then create alignment around shared goals.
quote: "We have to understand the CEO and leadership teams, what do they care about? What's important to them? How can we incent them? How can they make a lot of money for working really hard? How can we give them the leeway to try out new things? What drives them?"
source: Orlando Bravo, Founder and Managing Partner, Thoma Bravo, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: TB maintains humility and groundedness even during successful outcomes
question: Tell me about a time when you achieved significant success but had to stay humble and focused on continuous improvement.
quote: "One of the cultural traits from Stanford GSB that we share is that you can be the highest performing individual, but you can stay humble, have fun, and be a real person. When we have successful deals, nobody levitates, thinking that they're better than anyone."
source: Orlando Bravo, Founder and Managing Partner, Thoma Bravo, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: TB delivers superior value through open, collaborative and respectful partnerships
question: Tell me about a time when you contributed to a team effort where collaboration and mutual respect were essential to achieving the desired outcome.
quote: "Delivering growth and innovation is a result of our focus on delivering superior value centered around open, collaborative and respectful partnerships. Our values reflect our commitment and entrepreneurial approach to these partnerships."

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Insight views itself as a service provider rather than just a capital provider
question: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond your basic job requirements to provide exceptional service to a client or colleague.
quote: "We really think of ourselves as a service provider."
source: Deven Parekh, Managing Director, Insight Partners, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Insight's success is driven by genuine passion for software companies and having fun doing it
question: Tell me about a time when your genuine passion for something helped you persist through challenges and ultimately achieve success.
quote: "Deven highlights passion, sourcing, and onsite support as consistent and key drivers for Insight's success. Passion: Deven and the team genuinely love investing in software companies and have fun doing it."
source: Deven Parekh, Managing Director, Insight Partners, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Insight empowers and provides responsibility to next generation leaders
question: Tell me about a time when you mentored or empowered a junior colleague, giving them both feedback and real responsibility to grow.
quote: "Parekh reflected on Insight's next generation of investors, emphasizing that it isn't just about providing feedback but also offering empowerment and responsibility. He spoke about how many senior leaders started as analysts at the firm, climbing to the role of managing director."
source: Deven Parekh, Managing Director, Insight Partners, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Insight focuses on AI implementations that lower costs while improving customer satisfaction
question: Tell me about a time when you implemented a technology solution that delivered both operational efficiency and enhanced customer experience.
quote: "We're seeing companies that implement AI not only lower costs but actually improve customer satisfaction. It's a powerful combination that has never really existed before."
source: Deven Parekh, Managing Director, Insight Partners, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Insight prioritizes overall portfolio returns over individual investment wins
question: Tell me about a time when you made a decision that benefited the overall team or organization even though it might not have maximized your individual recognition.
quote: "In the end, I believe the most important thing is each strategy contributing to our overall returns."
source: Deven Parekh, Managing Director, Insight Partners, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: TA believes boards should include executives with varied backgrounds and experience
question: Tell me about a time when you contributed a unique perspective to a team or project because of your different background or experience.
quote: "As a firm, TA Associates believes it is critical for boards to be comprised of executives with a variety of backgrounds and experience."
source: Brian Conway, Former Chairman and Managing Partner, TA Associates, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: TA recognizes team members who provide tremendous value-add to portfolio companies
question: Tell me about a time when you went beyond your core responsibilities to add significant value to a project or organization.
quote: "It is an honor to recognize the promotions earned by these talented and dedicated team members who have provided a tremendous level of value-add to TA Associates' portfolio companies and ultimately for our investors."
source: Brian Conway, Former Chairman and Managing Partner, TA Associates, 2020

role: Senior
principle_description: TA drives genuine change by bringing together top executives to strategize modern boards
question: Tell me about a time when you brought together diverse stakeholders to drive strategic change and build consensus around a new approach.
quote: "Bringing together top CEOs, board directors and investors to discuss and strategize ways to drive genuine change and building modern, strategic boards comprised of high performing individuals with unique talents and perspectives."
source: Brian Conway, Former Chairman and Managing Partner, TA Associates, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: TA values judgment, creativity and work ethic as critical qualities for success
question: Tell me about a time when you had to exercise significant judgment in an ambiguous situation, using creativity to develop a solution that others hadn't considered.
quote: "Judgment, creativity and work ethic as critical qualities for success."
source: Brian Conway, Former Chairman and Managing Partner, TA Associates, 2020

role: Mid Level
principle_description: TA builds boards of high performing individuals with unique talents
question: Tell me about a time when you had to perform at a high level while working with other high performers who had different strengths than you.
quote: "Building modern, strategic boards comprised of high performing individuals with unique talents and perspectives."
source: Brian Conway, Former Chairman and Managing Partner, TA Associates, 2024Boeing
column12: Every employee is empowered as an aviation safety advocate
column13: Tell me about a time when you spoke up about a safety concern or potential problem that others might have overlooked. How did you handle the situation?
column16: We've asked every one of our employees to consider themselves an aviation safety advocate. We are committed to making sure every employee feels empowered to speak up if there is a problem.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Leading with complete transparency and taking responsibility for failures
question: Tell me about a time when you had to admit to a significant mistake or failure. How did you communicate this to stakeholders and what actions did you take?
quote: We must continue to respond to this accident with humility and complete transparency. We also must inculcate a total commitment to safety and quality at every level of our company.
source: Dave Calhoun CEO Alaska Airlines Message 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Listening starts with leadership and reacting appropriately to concerns
question: Tell me about a time when you discovered your team wasn't bringing important issues to your attention. How did you change your approach to encourage more open communication?
quote: The system didn't apparently listen or watch for things like that and it didn't react appropriately. And I have to do everything in my power to make sure going forward that it does. Listening starts with leadership and it starts with me.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Strengthening safety culture and rebuilding trust through systematic improvement
question: Tell me about a time when you led a major cultural transformation in response to a crisis. What was your approach and how did you measure progress?
quote: Working together we will strengthen our safety culture improve transparency and rebuild trust.
source: Dave Calhoun CEO Message to Team 2020

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Creating an environment where employees feel safe to raise concerns without retaliation
question: Tell me about a time when you had to encourage someone on your team to voice a concern they were hesitant to share. How did you create a safe environment for that conversation?
quote: We are committed to making sure every employee feels empowered to speak up if there is a problem. We also have strict policies in place to prohibit retaliation against employees who come forward.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Acknowledging imperfection while committing to progress and learning
question: Tell me about a time when you worked on improving a process or system that had significant flaws. How did you approach making incremental improvements?
quote: Our culture is far from perfect but we are taking action and making progress. We understand the gravity and we are committed to moving forward with transparency and accountability.

role: Entry Level
principle_name: Zero Crashes Zero Emissions Zero Congestion
principle_description: GM's North Star vision guiding all decisions and actions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to align your work with a larger organizational mission or vision. How did you ensure your daily tasks supported the bigger picture?
quote: At General Motors we have a vision of zero crashes zero emissions zero congestion. It is our North Star that guides everything we do.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Taking responsibility to be part of the solution through electrification
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative to address an environmental or social challenge. What was your approach and what impact did you achieve?
quote: Climate change is real and we want to be part of the solution by putting everyone in an electric vehicle.

role: Senior
principle_description: Engaging employees in meaningful work that impacts future generations
question: Tell me about a time when you had to transform a team or organization around a new purpose. How did you get people excited about the change?
quote: Our employees are excited about that and they want to be part of it because they want to make sure not are they working for a company that's doing the right thing but it's doing the right thing for the environment for safety not only for their children but for their children's children.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Taking responsibility to solve critical societal issues
question: Tell me about a time when you took on responsibility for solving a problem that extended beyond your immediate role or department. What motivated you and how did you approach it?
quote: I really see it as our responsibility to solve some of the issues around crashes and emissions and congestion.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Having the talent and technology to create transformational change
question: Tell me about a time when you had to convince others that an ambitious goal was achievable. How did you demonstrate that you had the capability to deliver?
quote: The good news is we have the ambition the talent and the technology to create a world with zero crashes zero emissions and zero congestion.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Attracting people who believe in the vision and want to contribute
question: Tell me about a time when you joined a team or organization because you were passionate about their mission. How did that motivation influence your performance?
quote: About 40% of our salary employees have been with the company for less than five years and they've joined because they believe in the vision and they want to be a part of it.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Giving people what they want through better customer experiences
question: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond to understand what a customer or client really needed. How did you use that insight to improve your service?
quote: Give people what they want—that was the mantra from CEO Jim Farley. The most important thing is the fitness of the company to use that platform to make a better experience for the customer.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Building resilient companies that can adapt and thrive during transformation
question: Tell me about a time when you had to quickly adapt your approach or strategy in response to unexpected changes. How did you maintain performance while pivoting?
quote: As a leader during transformation you have to be out in front — show that you want to learn be curious introduce new ideas ask questions.

role: Senior
principle_description: Making decisions with the next generation and future decades in mind
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision that prioritized long-term benefits over short-term gains. How did you justify this approach to stakeholders?
quote: The only thing I really think about is: How are we making decisions and getting things done such that Walmart is succeeding and creating value 50 years from now?

role: Leadership
principle_description: Using software and connectivity to create better customer experiences
question: Tell me about a time when you led a digital transformation initiative. How did you balance technological advancement with human needs?
quote: There is all sorts of functionality on the software side that you can't get in a non-electrified vehicle. The future is as much about features and connected services as the vehicles those offerings are in.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Adapting to market realities while maintaining strategic direction
question: Tell me about a time when you had to adjust your strategy based on new market information or customer feedback. How did you communicate this change?
quote: Partial electrification options like hybrids and extended-range electric vehicles are more than just transitional technologies.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Targeting consistent operational performance with clear metrics
question: Tell me about a time when you had to improve a process or operation to meet specific performance targets. What approach did you take?
quote: The company is targeting consistent operating performance that includes adjusted earnings before interest and taxes of 8% of revenue with strong automotive adjusted free cash flow.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Making storytelling the distinctive foundation from which all business grows
question: Tell me about a time when you had to communicate a complex idea or project in a compelling way. How did you craft your narrative to engage your audience?
quote: If Disney only does one thing well it should be storytelling and then the entire business will grow from there. Telling stories is where Disney should be distinctive and should be #1.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Refusing to accept mediocrity and demanding excellence in all work
question: Tell me about a time when you had to push back against accepting a mediocre solution. How did you drive the team toward excellence?
quote: I'm amazed at how many times people are willing to accept mediocrity. One of the things I learned from Steve Jobs is how he demanded excellence. And the results he got were obvious.

role: Senior
principle_description: Creating room to fail in order to drive innovation and creativity
question: Tell me about a time when you encouraged your team to take creative risks that might not succeed. How did you balance innovation with business objectives?
quote: There is no science in creativity. If you don't give yourself room to fail you won't innovate.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Creating trust and collaboration through fairness and treating others with respect
question: Tell me about a time when you had to address a situation where team members weren't feeling heard or respected. How did you rebuild trust?
quote: From his commitment to diversity and inclusion to his willingness to listen to dissenting voices Iger's dedication to fairness created a culture of trust and collaboration essential to Disney's success.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Maintaining positivity and finding paths to the best possible outcomes
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead through a difficult period while maintaining team morale. How did you stay optimistic and help others see possibility?
quote: Bob Iger believes that optimism is one of the most important leadership qualities to cultivate because even in the face of difficulty an optimistic leader will find the path toward the best possible outcome.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Investing capital primarily in high-quality branded content and creativity
question: Tell me about a time when you had to prioritize resource allocation toward creative or innovative projects. How did you justify this investment?
quote: Iger's first strategic priority was to invest most of our capital in creativity or what he called high-quality branded content.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Using technology to serve people while maintaining human-centered focus
question: Tell me about a time when you implemented a technology solution while ensuring it enhanced rather than replaced human interaction. How did you balance both aspects?
quote: Looking ahead we will compete with technology but win with people. We will be people-led and tech-empowered.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Putting customer wants and needs above all other considerations
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision that prioritized customer needs over internal convenience. What was your reasoning?
quote: It's really simple: If you're not meeting the wants and needs of the customer you're done. There's not a lot of loyalty here.

role: Senior
principle_description: Getting comfortable with calculated risks to enable meaningful change and growth
question: Tell me about a time when you had to convince others to take a significant risk for potential growth. How did you assess and manage that risk?
quote: There is no growth without change and there is no meaningful change without risk. So get comfortable with an intelligent level of risk.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Making decisions that create value for future generations
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make strategic decisions that wouldn't show immediate results but were important for long-term success. How did you maintain stakeholder support?
quote: The only thing I really think about is: How are we making decisions and getting things done such that Walmart is succeeding and creating value 50 years from now?

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Anchoring leadership in core values of respect integrity service and excellence
question: Tell me about a time when you had to uphold company values even when it was challenging or costly. How did you navigate the situation?
quote: McMillon credits his success to anchoring his leadership in Walmart's core values: respect integrity service and excellence.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Showing willingness to learn be curious and introduce new ideas during transformation
question: Tell me about a time when you had to learn something completely new to be effective in your role. How did you approach the learning process?
quote: As a leader during transformation you have to be out in front — show that you want to learn be curious introduce new ideas ask questions.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Working daily to help all families discover the joy of everyday life
question: Tell me about a time when you went out of your way to help someone have a better experience. How did your actions align with creating joy for others?
quote: Purpose-driven team of more than 400000 who work daily to help all families discover the joy of everyday life.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Creating joy in the lives of guests through exceptional service
question: Tell me about a time when you had to solve a problem for a customer or client that required going beyond standard procedures. How did you approach it?
quote: I see goodness when I look into the eyes of our team members in the stores who know how to create joy in the lives of our guests.

role: Senior
principle_description: Making diversity equity and inclusion part of leadership strategy and culture
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead an initiative to make your workplace more inclusive. What was your approach and what challenges did you face?
quote: It's part of how we lead it's part of our strategy it's part of our culture it's how we run the company. That's why we've seen growth.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Making decisions based on core values of inclusivity connection and drive
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision that tested your core values. How did you navigate competing priorities?
quote: Target's values of inclusivity connection drive were not up for debate.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Recognizing and supporting team members who demonstrate resilience during challenges
question: Tell me about a time when you had to support team members who were going through a difficult period while maintaining performance. How did you balance both needs?
quote: When I look at the Target team. It's humbling and inspiring to watch our team's resilience and I'm grateful for the essential role they play for our guests during this crisis while also taking care of themselves and their families.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Understanding that strong culture is the glue holding the company together
question: Tell me about a time when you contributed to building or strengthening team culture. What specific actions did you take?
quote: A strong culture is the glue holding the company together and driving its ongoing growth.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Putting customers first followed by associates then support and leadership
question: Tell me about a time when you had to prioritize a customer need over your own convenience or preferences. How did you handle the situation?
quote: In the inverted pyramid model the customer comes first then associates followed by field support corporate support and finally leadership at the bottom.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Living company values through actions of respect relationships and doing the right thing
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision that tested your values. How did you ensure you did the right thing?
quote: The values wheel consists of eight values: respect for all people giving back to the community building strong relationships doing the right thing providing an entrepreneurial spirit providing excellent customer service and taking care of its people.

role: Senior
principle_description: Taking care of associates so they can take care of customers
question: Tell me about a time when you had to invest in developing or supporting your team members. How did this investment impact customer outcomes?
quote: If you take care of your associates they'll take care of the customers and the rest will take care of itself.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Ensuring customers always have access to the best assortment quantity price and assistance
question: Tell me about a time when you had to go to extraordinary lengths to meet a customer commitment. What obstacles did you overcome?
quote: The company follows a philosophy of whatever it takes exemplified by its Customer Bill of Rights ensuring customers always have access to the best assortment quantity and price along with knowledgeable assistance.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Being agile and responsive while maintaining long-term planning focus
question: Tell me about a time when you had to quickly adapt your plans while keeping your team focused on long-term goals. How did you manage both priorities?
quote: As we learned through COVID we have to be agile. Everyone has a plan until they get punched in the mouth. We are constantly updating forecasts — yearly quarterly monthly weekly — to respond in real time.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Understanding that life is an endurance sport requiring resilience through challenges
question: Tell me about a time when you faced professional adversity and had to persevere. How did you maintain your effectiveness during that period?
quote: Life is an endurance sport and you're going to have professional and personal adversity and being resilient is just a huge piece of ultimately being happy.
source: Ted Decker CEO on ResilienceUnitedHealth Group
column12: Integrating disparate parts of the healthcare system to achieve sustained improvements
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to work across different teams or departments to solve a complex problem, and how you broke down barriers to achieve success.
column16: We know it's sustainable—that's really the key to our strategy. The idea of breaking down silos and integrating disparate parts of the system is a key tenet that undergirds UnitedHealth's own push for innovation.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Developing solutions that work together in a broader ecosystem rather than single innovations
question: Tell me about a time when you developed a solution that needed to integrate with multiple existing systems or processes, and how you ensured it worked effectively within the broader framework.
quote: We're not looking to develop a single, new gadget but rather to develop solutions that work together in a broader ecosystem.

role: Senior
question: consumers
question_type: and members first in all decisions and actions
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision that prioritized customer/patient needs over other business considerations.
quote: Values
column10: We continue to make sure that we put patients, consumers, and members first, as we always have done. The mission of this company is truly to make sure that we help the system improve by helping the experience for individuals get better and better.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Partnering across the industry to improve healthcare delivery and reduce costs
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative that required collaboration with external partners or competitors to achieve a common goal.
quote: We are willing to partner with anyone, as we always have — health care providers, employers, patients, pharmaceutical companies, governments and others — to find ways to deliver high-quality care and lower costs.

role: Mid Level
question: appropriate
question_type: and delivered when people need it
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you identified a quality or safety issue in your work and what steps you took to address it.
quote: Culture Fit
column10: Our role is a critical role, and we make sure that care is safe, appropriate, and it's delivered when people need it. We guard against the pressures that exist for unsafe care or for unnecessary care to be delivered.
column11: Andrew Witty, CEO, CNN Video Message, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Using comprehensive clinical evidence to achieve best health outcomes
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a recommendation based on data and evidence, even when it went against popular opinion.
quote: Behind each decision lies a comprehensive and continually updated body of clinical evidence focused on achieving the best health outcomes and ensuring patient safety.

role: Entry Level
question: behavioral
question_type: and social needs to improve health outcomes
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you took a holistic approach to solving a problem, considering multiple factors rather than just the obvious solution.
quote: Problem Solving
column10: Our whole-health approach is about simplifying health care and building trust with customers. We partner to address physical, behavioral, and social needs to improve health, affordability, quality, equity, and access.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Using digital technologies to transform business operations and consumer interactions
question: Tell me about a time when you successfully implemented or improved a digital process that enhanced customer experience or operational efficiency.
quote: We led the transformation of Elevance Health into a digital-first healthcare company, using digital technologies to transform the way we operate our business and interact with consumers.

role: Senior
principle_description: Ensuring everyone has a fair opportunity to be as healthy as possible
question: Tell me about a time when you identified and addressed an equity or fairness issue in your workplace or community.
quote: We believe everyone should have a fair and just opportunity to be as healthy as possible. We educate, enable and empower colleagues so everyone is part of the solution.
source: Gail Boudreaux, CEO, Company Health Equity Statement, 2020-2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Applying lessons from athletics including flexibility
question: goal-setting
difficulty: Tell me about a time when your initial plan failed, and how you adapted your approach to ultimately achieve success.
quote: Leadership
column10: Sport teaches you there's always another move. You might have the best plan, mapped out every step and still fail. When that happens, being flexible and having an open mind helps you come back better the next time.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Making a positive difference in people's lives through daily work
question: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond in your role because you believed strongly in the mission or purpose of your work.
quote: With our purpose to improve the health of humanity and deep ties to communities, no company can make an impact like Anthem. Our daily work makes a positive difference in people's lives.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Thriving on the connection between associates and the members they serve
question: Tell me about a time when you built a strong relationship with a customer or colleague that led to better outcomes for everyone involved.
quote: Elevance Health is a company that thrives on the connection between our associates and the members they serve, the opportunity and the privilege to make a difference for the people we serve.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Designing healthcare experiences around the consumer's needs
question: Tell me about a time when you redesigned a process or service to better meet customer needs and expectations.
quote: Health care, now is the time for health care to be designed around the consumer.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Addressing preventable differences in access to care and health outcomes
question: Tell me about a time when you identified and worked to eliminate barriers that prevented equal access or opportunities.
quote: The pandemic shined a bright light on the inequities of health in America. We believe that there are preventable differences in access to care and health outcomes. We're making a big commitment striving to improve America's access to health care.

role: Senior
principle_description: Being authentic and working in environments that welcome who you are
question: Tell me about a time when you had to be vulnerable or show authenticity as a leader, and how it impacted your team or organization.
quote: Be who you are and be authentic and be yourself because-- and work at places that really welcome who you are.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Making healthcare more accessible through digital and virtual health capabilities
question: Tell me about a time when you led a digital transformation initiative that significantly improved service delivery or accessibility.
quote: CVS Health facilitated 20 million virtual health visits between 2020 and 2021, up from 20,000 in 2019, investing in digital and telehealth capabilities.
source: Karen Lynch, CEO, Company Performance Data, 2021

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Tying diversity commitments to executive accountability and compensation
question: Tell me about a time when you took concrete action to improve diversity and inclusion in your workplace or team.
quote: CVS is one of the few companies that have made that commitment and really put our executive compensation behind our diversity commitments.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Using personal experiences to drive healthcare vision and improve patient care
question: Tell me about a time when a personal experience motivated you to make a positive change in your work or community.
quote: Lynch regularly told the story of her traumatic youth with vulnerability uncharacteristic of most corporate leaders, hoping sharing their stories would help drive home the vision behind her push to make CVS a single point of care for patients.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Measuring success through improved health outcomes and healthy days
question: Tell me about a time when you set measurable goals for improvement and successfully achieved them.
quote: We want to improve the health outcomes of our communities 20 percent by 2020. We measure this through 'healthy days,' asking members four questions about their physical and behavioral activities.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Moving from episodic care to managing chronic conditions in clinical and everyday settings
question: Tell me about a time when you helped transition a process from reactive to proactive management, focusing on prevention rather than problem-solving after the fact.
quote: Part of the problem with healthcare was that the system was built on an episodic model, rather than a model that helps individuals manage their chronic conditions—both in a clinical setting and in their everyday lives.
source: Bruce Broussard, CEO, Oliver Wyman Interview, 2020

role: Senior
question: senior-focused
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you developed or improved a service specifically focused on serving an underserved or specialized population.
quote: Values
column10: High-quality, value-based primary care is a critical influence point to help deliver easier experiences and better health outcomes for individuals, especially seniors with chronic conditions.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Aligning leadership compensation with member health engagement scores
question: Tell me about a time when you aligned team incentives with desired outcomes to drive better performance.
quote: Compensation for his senior leadership team was based not only on earnings per share but also on the health engagement scores of members.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Leveraging digital health and logistics to transform care delivery in the home
question: Tell me about a time when you found an innovative way to deliver services in a more convenient or accessible manner.
quote: The home, aided by advances in digital health and logistics technology, has the potential to transform the delivery of care as a more convenient setting that can potentially lower costs.
source: Bruce Broussard, CEO, Healthcare Leaders Media, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Valuing diversity as critical for solving organizational challenges
question: Tell me about a time when diverse perspectives on your team led to a better solution than you initially considered.
quote: Diversity is really good business. When you have a challenge in an organization, having diversity of thought is critical because you get representation from all points of view.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Putting people first and demonstrating care in every interaction
question: Tell me about a time when you went out of your way to put people first, even when it required extra effort or resources.
quote: Heart at Work Behaviors: Putting people first, Rising to the challenge, Joining forces, Create simplicity, Inspire trust, and Champion safety and quality.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Providing care that respects diverse cultural health beliefs
question: behaviors and needs
question_type: Tell me about a time when you adapted your approach to work effectively with someone from a different cultural background or with different needs.
quote: Medium
source: Members have diverse cultural health beliefs, behaviors and needs, and deserve to be treated with dignity, respect and fairness. We emphasize providers' responsibility in providing culturally competent care.
column10: Company Cultural Competency Policy, Aetna CVS Health, 2020-2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Helping people access quality care and social resources in their communities
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative to improve access to services or resources for an underserved community.
quote: At Aetna, we believe everyone should have a fair and just opportunity to be as healthy as possible. We're committed to helping people access quality care and social resources in their communities.
source: Company Health Equity Statement, Aetna CVS Health, 2020-2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Creating innovative digital solutions to make healthcare more accessible and integrated
question: Tell me about a time when you spearheaded an innovation that significantly improved accessibility or integration of services.
quote: CVS Health is embarking on a bold digital agenda to transform health care, creating innovative digital solutions that will make healthcare more accessible, more integrated and more reliable for more people.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Improving health of communities through local presence and comprehensive care
question: Tell me about a time when you contributed to improving outcomes for your local community or workplace environment.
quote: CVS Health delivers care like no one else can, reaching more people and improving the health of communities across America through their local presence and digital channels.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Improving the health and vitality of those we serve
question: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond to help improve someone's well-being or success.
quote: Our mission is to improve the health and vitality of those we serve.
source: David Cordani, CEO, Company Mission Statement, 2020-2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Focusing on health outcomes rather than consumption of services
question: Tell me about a time when you shifted focus from activity-based to results-based measurement and what impact it had.
quote: We're a $4.5 trillion ecosystem, and the vast majority of that spending pays based on the consumption of services, not on the outcomes achieved. We need to align incentives within the health care system based on outcomes rather than consumption.
source: David Cordani, CEO, Evernorth Outcomes Event, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Focusing on preventing health issues before they become costly conditions
question: Tell me about a time when you implemented a preventive approach that saved time, money, or resources in the long run.
quote: What is the least expensive health care there is? The answer is, the one that never needs to happen. We need to focus on how we help improve health in the first place or maintain health on a more aggressive basis.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Understanding that individual vitality drives organizational performance
question: Tell me about a time when you recognized the connection between employee well-being and performance, and took action to address it.
quote: If we could lift the vitality of an individual, we lift the performance of a corporation or an employer. We lift performance through higher levels of engagement and presenteeism, lower levels of turnover, and higher productivity.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Recognizing the inextricable link between mental and physical health
question: Tell me about a time when you addressed a problem by considering both its emotional/psychological and practical/physical aspects.
quote: We have a mental health challenge within our society. And mental health and physical health are inextricably linked.

role: Senior
principle_description: Creating systematic collaborative approaches where everyone owns the solution
question: Tell me about a time when you built a collaborative culture around a shared goal, ensuring everyone felt ownership of the outcome.
quote: Building a culture of health needs to be collaborative. We can systemize ourselves to achieve a much better sustainable outcome. But we cannot just do it with a decree. We must operationalize this, so everybody owns it.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Implementing programs that integrate coverage with lifestyle and behavior change
question: Tell me about a time when you designed or implemented a solution that addressed multiple aspects of a complex problem simultaneously.
quote: The Cigna Group's efforts to innovate and implement programs that focus on health improvement and preventive care, including the EncircleRx program, which integrates coverage for GLP-1 drugs with lifestyle and behavior change programs.
source: David Cordani, CEO, Program Implementation, 2024Warner Bros Discovery
column12: Delivering consistent quality content that shapes culture and creates appointment viewing
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to maintain consistent quality standards while working under pressure or tight deadlines.
column16: Even in an industry of hits and misses, we must acknowledge that our studios business must deliver more consistency. Stories like The Penguin that can shape culture, spark conversations, and become appointment viewing, always win over time.
column17: David Zaslav, CEO, Earnings Call, November 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Prioritizing seamless and intuitive user experiences across all platforms and touchpoints
question: Tell me about a time when you identified a poor user experience and took action to improve it for customers.
quote: This is an industry that really needs to meaningfully consolidate, and it's really driven by the consumer experience. Consumers turn on a TV set and they see 16 apps, and each of those [have] different pricing, and you're sitting there with your phone and googling where a show is or where a sport is.

role: Senior
principle_description: Running the company with maximum efficiency and effectiveness while considering all strategic options
question: Tell me about a time when you had to optimize operations and evaluate multiple strategic options during a challenging period.
quote: We feel good about where we are. We have to look at all and consider all options, but the No. 1 priority is to run this company as effectively as possible.
source: David Zaslav, CEO, Public Statement, August 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Leading consolidation and change to strengthen the media industry and improve consumer experience
question: Tell me about a time when you led a significant transformation or consolidation effort that benefited both your organization and the broader industry.
quote: It may offer a pace of change and an opportunity for consolidation that may be quite different, that would provide a real positive and accelerated impact on this industry that's needed.
source: David Zaslav, CEO, Public Statement, November 2024

role: Entry Level
question: respectful workplace where principles and policies are upheld
question_type: Tell me about a time when you witnessed or addressed a situation that violated workplace principles or created an unsafe environment.
quote: Medium
source: You should count on your leaders to create a safe and respectful workplace. When our principles and policies are violated, we will always move quickly to take appropriate action, as we have done here.
column10: Brian Roberts & Mike Cavanagh, Leadership Statement, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Maintaining business focus and team stability during transitions and unexpected changes
question: Tell me about a time when you helped maintain team focus and stability during an unexpected change or transition.
quote: Think of me as being here for a while. Just settle things down and make sure the businesses and the business leaders and NBCU remain focused on the job at hand.

role: Senior
principle_description: Maintaining strategic direction while adapting to environmental changes without overreacting to leadership transitions
question: Tell me about a time when you maintained strategic consistency during a period of change while still adapting to new circumstances.
quote: There is no reason for anyone to think we're going to be revisiting our strategy as a result of that all by itself. We will obviously react as the environment changes around us.

role: Leadership
question: growth
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you led a significant transformation initiative that combined organic growth with strategic partnerships or acquisitions.
quote: Leadership
column10: Under Brian's leadership, Comcast has transformed through organic growth, new business innovations, and strategic transactions.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Operating as a hit-making content creation machine across multiple genres and platforms
question: Tell me about a time when you contributed to creating or improving a product or service that had broad appeal across different audiences.
quote: At the end of the day, what we are is a hit-making content machine on the film side and on the television side, across multiple genres, from kids to unscripted to scripted — everything.
source: George Cheeks, CEO CBS, Interview, June 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Implementing aligned global strategies while ensuring effective local market execution
question: Tell me about a time when you implemented a company-wide initiative while adapting it to meet specific local or regional needs.
quote: Today, we have an aligned leadership team, and we are going after things globally. So the time has come to actually really do global leadership of free-to-air, streaming and cable networks, combined with local execution.
source: Bob Bakish, Former CEO, Public Statement, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Managing through disruptions by having multiple contingency plans and levers to pull
question: Tell me about a time when you managed through a significant disruption or crisis by utilizing multiple strategies and contingency plans.
quote: Obviously, we've been planning for this, we do have many levers to pull and that'll allow us to manage through the strike, even if it's for an extended duration.
source: Bob Bakish, Former CEO, Q1 2023 Earnings Call

role: Leadership
question: camaraderie
difficulty: Tell me about a time when you built a successful partnership or team collaboration based on mutual respect and shared vision.
quote: Teamwork
column10: This new structure will allow us to continue leveraging the power of the entire company. Ours is a partnership built on respect, camaraderie and, most importantly, a shared love of Paramount Global, its employees and our world-class content.
column11: Office of the CEO, Staff Memo, April 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Acknowledging and celebrating team contributions to organizational success
question: Tell me about a time when you recognized or celebrated team members' contributions during a challenging period.
quote: Several months ago when I first wrote to you about COVID-19, we all hoped that the duration and severity of the pandemic's impact would be far less substantial than what we have experienced so far. Notwithstanding the personal challenges we face and professional reimagining that we continue to undertake, your groups have collaborated to ensure that FOX continues to serve our viewers, partners and other stakeholders.
source: Lachlan Murdoch, Executive Chairman, Company Memo, 2020

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Standing firm on editorial decisions and values despite external pressure
question: Tell me about a time when you stood by an important decision or principle despite facing external pressure or criticism.
quote: Congratulations are in order to the chairman of Fox News, Lachlan Murdoch, for his refusal to bow to a demand that he fire Tucker Carlson. It's nice to see a press baron standing up for a controversial newsroom star for a change.
source: The New York Sun, Editorial Commentary, 2021

role: Senior
principle_description: Ensuring collaborative efforts continue to serve stakeholders during organizational change
question: Tell me about a time when you led collaborative efforts to maintain service quality during a period of significant change or uncertainty.
quote: Notwithstanding the personal challenges we face and professional reimagining that we continue to undertake, your groups have collaborated to ensure that FOX continues to serve our viewers, partners and other stakeholders.
source: Lachlan Murdoch, Executive Chairman, Company Memo, 2020

role: Leadership
principle_description: Maintaining unwavering commitment to core values of freedom and independence
question: Tell me about a time when you demonstrated unwavering commitment to your organization's core values in the face of challenges.
quote: My father firmly believed in freedom, and Lachlan is absolutely committed to the cause.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Investing in and developing new talent as the fundamental building block of success
question: Tell me about a time when you invested time or resources in developing someone's potential that led to positive results.
quote: Our company's fundamental building block is artist development and in 2024, investment in new talent continued to produce spectacular results around the world.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Ensuring fair compensation and treatment by addressing systemic issues that affect creators
question: Tell me about a time when you identified and addressed an unfair system or process that was negatively impacting others.
quote: Our pioneering artist-centric strategy will extend its reach. We first focused on a fairer way to allocate the streaming pie among real artists by addressing fraud and other aspects that deprive artists of their just compensation.

role: Senior
principle_description: Strengthening stakeholder relationships through innovative experiences and value-added services
question: Tell me about a time when you strengthened important business relationships by creating new experiences or value-added services.
quote: The next focus of our strategy will be to grow the pie for all artists, by strengthening the artist-fan relationship through superfan experiences and products.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Creating innovative models and structures that serve as blueprints for industry transformation
question: Tell me about a time when you created an innovative approach or model that others in your industry adopted or used as a blueprint.
quote: In short, we are creating the blueprint for the labels of the future.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Embracing calculated risks to create exceptional entertainment experiences
question: Tell me about a time when you took a calculated risk to improve the quality of your work or achieve better results.
quote: To take great filmed entertainment comes from a willingness to take risks.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Maintaining employment stability and team cohesion during industry disruptions
question: Tell me about a time when you helped maintain team stability and morale during a challenging period or industry disruption.
quote: I'm intensely proud of how we navigated Covid. Unlike many, we had no layoffs.

role: Senior
principle_description: Identifying and focusing on valuable assets and opportunities that others may overlook
question: Tell me about a time when you identified valuable assets or opportunities that others had overlooked and successfully leveraged them.
quote: When I took over Sony, it was said, oh, Sony has no IP. Not true. We actually had fantastic IP. We just needed to focus on it.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Creating lasting value by ensuring successful outcomes regardless of changing market conditions
question: Tell me about a time when you created lasting value for your organization by focusing on successful outcomes despite changing market conditions.
quote: Successful movies become more valuable regardless of distribution platform changes.
column12: Commitment to promoting long-term value over short-term gains through fiduciary responsibility
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to advocate for a long-term strategy that required short-term sacrifices or investments, and how you convinced stakeholders to support your approach.
column16: The money we manage is not our own. It belongs to people in dozens of countries trying to finance long-term goals like retirement. And we have a deep responsibility to these institutions and individuals – who are shareholders in your company and thousands of others – to promote long-term value.
column17: Larry Fink, CEO, 2020 Annual Letter to CEOs, 2020

role: Senior
principle_description: Leadership that addresses stakeholder needs beyond shareholders, including employees, communities, and society
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead your team through a crisis while balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders (employees, clients, community). How did you ensure all voices were heard and needs addressed?
quote: I cannot recall a time where it has been more important for companies to respond to the needs of their stakeholders. We are at a moment of tremendous economic pain. We are also at a historic crossroads on the path to racial justice – one that cannot be solved without leadership from companies.
source: Larry Fink, CEO, 2021 Annual Letter to CEOs, 2021

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Commitment to developing diverse talent and creating inclusive environments
question: Tell me about a time when you worked to ensure your team or project included diverse perspectives and talent. What specific actions did you take and what was the outcome?
quote: A company that does not seek to benefit from the full spectrum of human talent is weaker for it – less likely to hire the best talent, less likely to reflect the needs of its customers and the communities where it operates, and less likely to outperform.
source: Larry Fink, CEO, 2021 Annual Letter to CEOs, 2021

role: Leadership
principle_description: Leading collaborative efforts to solve complex societal challenges through cross-sector partnerships
question: Tell me about a time when you had to bring together people from different organizations or backgrounds to solve a complex problem. How did you facilitate collaboration and ensure everyone contributed meaningfully?
quote: Maybe once a decade, the U.S. faces a problem so big and urgent that government and corporate leaders stop business as usual. They step out of their silos and sit around the same table to find a solution... We need to do something similar for the retirement crisis.
source: Larry Fink, CEO, 2024 Annual Letter to Investors, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Unwavering commitment to acting in clients' best interests above all other considerations
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision that was in your clients' or stakeholders' best interest, even though it wasn't the most profitable or popular choice for your organization.
quote: Vanguard can't promise to be a fiduciary to its clients while also committing to align its assets with the 2050 net-zero target.
source: Tim Buckley, CEO, Financial Times Interview, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Foundational belief in giving investors fair treatment and prioritizing client outcomes
question: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond to ensure a client or customer received fair treatment, even when it required extra effort or resources on your part.
quote: Thirty-three years ago, I was lucky to join a company that believed in giving investors a fair shake as they saved for retirement, for their kids' college education, or for their dream home.

role: Senior
principle_description: Measuring organizational success by client outcomes rather than traditional financial metrics
question: Tell me about a time when you implemented or advocated for performance metrics that prioritized customer success over traditional business metrics. How did you measure success and what were the results?
quote: Here's a radical idea: Measure the success of your business by the success your clients are able to achieve.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Commitment to developing the next generation of leaders within the organization
question: Tell me about a time when you mentored or developed someone on your team who went on to take on greater responsibilities. What was your approach and how did you measure their growth?
quote: I have been passionate about developing the next generation of leaders, and I look forward to those leaders elevating Vanguard to new heights.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Philosophy of challenging status quo and viewing change as opportunity for improvement
question: Tell me about a time when you identified an outdated process or approach in your work and took initiative to improve it. What was your approach and what resistance did you face?
quote: Always challenge the status quo and embrace change as an opportunity for improvement.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Expectation that all employees prioritize what's best for customers in decision-making
question: Tell me about a time when you had to choose between what was easier for your team/organization and what was truly best for the customer. How did you approach this situation?
quote: We expect all of our Fidelity associates to be customer obsessed, meaning always looking for what's going to be the best thing for the customer.
source: Abigail Johnson, CEO, Tufts University Interview, 2021

role: Senior
principle_description: Philosophy of taking calculated risks and prioritizing progress over perfectionism
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision with incomplete information or take a calculated risk to move a project forward. How did you balance risk with the need for progress?
quote: Taking smart risks and practicing pace over perfection... Keep moving, don't get hung up on being a perfectionist.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Proactively disrupting own business models to stay ahead of competition
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead a significant change or transformation that disrupted existing ways of working. How did you manage resistance and maintain team morale during the transition?
quote: I would rather disrupt ourselves than let us become complacent and get surprised by new ideas and innovations from a competitor.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Commitment to providing actionable insights beyond just execution to help clients navigate complexity
question: Tell me about a time when you went beyond completing assigned tasks to provide additional insights or recommendations that helped a client or stakeholder achieve better outcomes.
quote: Helping clients achieve better outcomes requires more than just execution — it requires actionable insight.
source: Ron O'Hanley, CEO, 2024 Annual Report Letter, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Embedding risk management as a fundamental part of organizational culture and decision-making
question: Tell me about a time when you identified a potential risk that others had overlooked and successfully influenced your team or organization to address it proactively.
quote: Our license to operate relies on our unwavering commitment to risk excellence and upholding the trust of clients and regulators. Risk management is embedded in our culture.
source: Ron O'Hanley, CEO, Annual Report Letter, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Belief in direct engagement with teams and operations to understand and improve performance
question: Tell me about a time when you took a hands-on approach to understand a problem or challenge by working directly with the people involved, rather than relying solely on reports or summaries.
quote: This has given me a chance to work with the team very directly, as opposed to indirectly, to see them in situ and watch them operate.
source: Ron O'Hanley, CEO, Global Custodian Interview, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Recognition that complex problems require sophisticated leadership approaches and collaborative solutions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead a team through solving a complex, multi-faceted problem that required input from various stakeholders and departments.
quote: Complex problems seldom have simple answers, which is why solving complex problems requires leadership.
source: Ron O'Hanley, CEO, Bentley University Commencement Address, 2019

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Maintaining organizational culture grounded in collaboration trust and integrity
question: Tell me about a time when you successfully collaborated with team members from different backgrounds or departments to achieve a shared goal. What did you do to ensure everyone felt included and valued?
quote: Maintaining an organizational culture grounded in collaboration, trust, and integrity remains central to our long-term success.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Belief that continuous learning and challenging conventional wisdom are key to success
question: Tell me about a time when you challenged a commonly accepted approach or conventional wisdom in your field. What research did you do and how did you present your alternative perspective?
quote: Intellectual curiosity and a continuous desire for learning are key factors in his success... My education has encouraged me to challenge conventional wisdom while learning to trust the expertise of those around me.
source: Rob Sharps, CEO, Towson University Alumni Profile, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Responsibility to be stewards of client and stockholder capital while investing in associates and communities
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance short-term financial pressures with long-term stewardship responsibilities to multiple stakeholders. How did you approach this challenge?
quote: As we seek to be admirable stewards of client and stockholder capital, we are also focused on empowering our associates and investing in our communities and a sustainable future.
source: Rob Sharps, CEO, Annual Report Message, 2023

role: Leadership
principle_description: Deep commitment to serving others as the foundation of leadership philosophy
question: Tell me about a time when you put the needs of your team members or clients ahead of your own interests or advancement. What was the situation and what was the outcome?
quote: My deep belief in servant leadership has guided me throughout my career.

role: Senior
principle_description: Transition from individual performance to developing and coaching others to achieve their potential
question: Tell me about a time when you had to shift from being the person who completed tasks to coaching others to excel in those same areas. What challenges did you face and how did you overcome them?
quote: I needed to make that transition, from 'doing,' to helping others and coaching them.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Creating culture where people feel safe to share honest feedback and critical information
question: Tell me about a time when you had to deliver difficult feedback or unwelcome news to leadership or colleagues. How did you ensure your message was heard while maintaining relationships?
quote: One is people telling you what they you want to hear. And the other is people being afraid to tell you what they think you need to know.
source: Walt Bettinger, CEO, Leadership Interview, 2019Electronic Arts
column12: Belief that games serve as social connection platforms bringing people together
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to pivot a project or initiative to better serve community needs, even when it meant significant changes to your original plan.
column16: What we saw through the pandemic was tens, maybe hundreds of millions of more people recognized that games were a lot of things. They are inspiration, they are escape, they are competition, they are self-improvement, they are creation. But what they really are is social connection.

role: Senior
principle_description: Leading entertainment companies through accelerating industry transformation
question: Tell me about a time when you led your team through a significant industry or technological change that required completely new approaches to your work.
quote: We're leading through an accelerating industry transformation where player needs and motivations have changed significantly. Fans are increasingly engaging with the largest IP, and looking to us for broader experiences where they can play, watch, create content, and forge deeper connections.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Using strategic thinking and preparation to compete effectively against larger competitors
question: Tell me about a time when you had to compete against a much larger or better-resourced competitor. How did you approach this challenge?
quote: In business, you know, relative to an Apple, or a Google, or an Amazon, we're like tiny, we're like 120 pounds relative to their 350. And so jiu-jitsu tells you that with the right technique and the right preparation, the right planning, you don't have to fear the big person.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Leveraging new technologies to dramatically improve operational efficiency
question: Tell me about a time when you implemented a new technology or process that significantly improved your team's efficiency. What was the impact?
quote: So we build a stadium in one of our sports games, that would typically take us six months. This past year, it took us six weeks. It's not unnatural for us to believe that in the coming years it will take us six days.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Leading through collaboration and surrounding yourself with experts
question: Tell me about a time when you had to work with team members who had more expertise than you in a particular area. How did you approach leading or contributing to that project?
quote: I tend to be collaborative. I like working with teams, I want to be surrounded by the best and the brightest, and I'm good with people who are smarter and more expert than I am. I'm self-confident enough to get out of their way and let them do their jobs.
source: Strauss Zelnick, CEO, Adam Mendler Interview, 2020-2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Believing that hard work and positive attitude are key differentiators early in careers
question: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond what was expected of you in a role. What motivated you to put in that extra effort?
quote: The only thing that will differentiate you early on is hard work and your attitude.

role: Senior
principle_description: Viewing new technology as productivity tools that enhance rather than replace human capability
question: Tell me about a time when you had to help your team adapt to new technology while maintaining focus on core human skills and creativity.
quote: The history of productivity tools is that it increases employment. It increases value, it increases yield, it enhances growth. All of these things will happen.
source: Strauss Zelnick, CEO, TD Cowen Conference, 2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Making strategic decisions to focus resources on core business growth
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision to stop or divest from a project to focus on higher-priority initiatives.
quote: We recently made the strategic decision to sell our Private Division label so we could focus our resources on growing our core businesses for the long term.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Creating environments where employees feel safe and supported to do their best work
question: Tell me about a time when you noticed a team member was struggling or felt unsafe in their work environment. How did you address this situation?
quote: Culture is a journey for any workplace it's something at team Xbox we've been focused on for, for quite a long time. We know that the most important thing to a creative organization is that the employees feel safe. They feel heard so they could do their best work. There's nothing that's more important to us.
source: Phil Spencer, CEO Microsoft Gaming, CNBC Interview, 2022

role: Senior
principle_description: Designing platforms that maximize opportunities for creators to reach diverse audiences
question: Tell me about a time when you had to balance competing stakeholder needs while building a platform or system that served creators or content producers.
quote: The longest goal for us is: 'Do creators on our platform feel like they have the best opportunity to reach the maximum number of players with the maximum creative diversity that they need?'
source: Phil Spencer, CEO Microsoft Gaming, Various interviews, 2022-2024

role: Leadership
principle_description: Taking personal responsibility for large-scale decisions while maintaining humility
question: Tell me about a time when you had to take on a significant responsibility that felt overwhelming. How did you approach it and what did you learn?
quote: There's a lot of responsibility for that. And I definitely feel that.
source: Phil Spencer, CEO Microsoft Gaming, Interview regarding Activision acquisition, 2022

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Creating games for the broadest possible audience focused on entertainment value
question: Tell me about a time when you had to refocus a project to ensure it appealed to a broader audience while maintaining quality and vision.
quote: I want to reaffirm that we are an entertainment-first company, creating games for the broadest possible audience, and our goal is not to push any specific agenda. We remain committed to creating games for fans and players that everyone can enjoy.

role: Senior
principle_description: Maintaining creative independence to preserve innovative game development
question: Tell me about a time when you had to defend your team's creative vision against external pressures or constraints.
quote: When you're attacked with a company that has a different philosophy, you know it can affect what you've been creating from scratch.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Ensuring all employees feel heard and respected in the workplace environment
question: Tell me about a time when you had to address workplace behavior issues and implement systemic changes to prevent future problems.
quote: The situations that some of you have experienced or witnessed are absolutely not acceptable. No one should ever feel harassed or disrespected at work, and the types of inappropriate behavior we have recently learned about cannot and will not be tolerated.
source: Yves Guillemot, CEO, Internal Company Letter, 2020

role: Senior
principle_description: Starting from core principles rather than just focusing on immediate business interests
