question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a business decision based on your principles, even when it might not have been the most profitable choice in the short term.
quote: I think we have to start from principles, right? Most companies focus just on their interests. And don't think about the full reciprocity of how do I want this to work as a consumer. I think we have to look at it from all perspectives and play out basic foundational principles as opposed to just doing what we want.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Ensuring creators maintain ownership of their work and receive fair compensation
question: Tell me about a time when you advocated for fair treatment or compensation for content creators or team members whose work was being used by others.
quote: The principle here is every creator owns their original creations and has the right to make the profit from them. And it's great to choose service providers they choose to work with, without being forced to accept a massive bundle of services in order to reach the customer base.

role: Leadership
question: interoperable systems that benefit all participants rather than creating closed ecosystems
question_type: Tell me about a time when you chose to build an open system or platform that competitors could also benefit from, rather than creating a closed competitive advantage.
quote: Hard
source: I think the future of the Metaverse has to be built on open protocols, open standards and interoperability of all forms. We need both technological interoperability so that any creator, any hosting provider, any ecosystem operator, any brand and any content can interoperate freely without being forced into any one company's walled garden of any sorts.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Making decisions that prioritize long-term player value over short-term financial gains
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision that prioritized long-term customer satisfaction over immediate revenue or cost savings.
quote: We're not doing this to appease shareholders or to hit some quarterly earnings number – we've made this decision because it's a necessity. It's what we need to do in order to maintain a long-term focus for players.

role: Senior
principle_description: Leading organizational change by truly listening to employee concerns without defensiveness
question: Tell me about a time when you had to listen to difficult feedback about your organization or leadership style and implement significant changes based on what you heard.
quote: This first point may seem cliché, but the simple act of listening was absolutely vital in planning Riot's path forward. At Riot we needed to listen. That meant no defensiveness, no excuses, no explanations. Just listening.
source: Nicolo Laurent, Former CEO, Riot Games Blog, 2020

role: Leadership
principle_description: Maintaining core principles and values even during organizational storms and external pressure
question: Tell me about a time when you had to lead through a significant crisis while staying true to your core values and principles.
quote: As a leader, define your principles… and stick to them. Listen so you don't miss the forest for the trees, focus on internal challenges despite external pressure, bring in experts, but stick to principles, even in the midst of a storm.
source: Nicolo Laurent, Former CEO, Riot Games Blog, 2020L.E.K. Consulting
column12: Building closely-connected supportive teams where someone always has your back
column13: Tell me about a time when you stepped up to support a teammate who was struggling with a challenging project or deadline.
column16: I will step into it with enthusiasm and confidence — because I know that what makes L.E.K. uniquely able to serve clients is our people, whose intelligence, commitment to doing the best work and collaborative nature make them the best in our industry.
column17: Clay Heskett, Global Managing Partner, L.E.K. Press Release, 2021

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Building upon prodigious talent resources while delivering game-changing guidance to clients
question: Tell me about a time when you identified an opportunity to improve a process or solution that led to better outcomes for stakeholders.
quote: I am excited about the growth and challenges ahead for L.E.K. Armed with our superb and always-evolving strategy and analytic capabilities, and with our commitment to constant improvement in terms of tools and talent, we will be able to serve even more business leaders, in more places, and show them how valuable our guidance can be.
source: Clay Heskett, Global Managing Partner, L.E.K. Press Release, 2021

role: Senior
principle_description: Helping business leaders at critical moments when they must make complex highly important decisions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to help others navigate a complex decision with significant consequences and uncertain outcomes.
quote: Clay is known for his success building and leading teams that help business leaders at critical moments when they must make complex, highly important decisions.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Turning new technologies and innovation into competitive advantages for clients
question: Tell me about a time when you successfully implemented or advocated for a new technology or innovative approach in your work.
quote: She has a proven track record of turning new technologies into competitive advantages and supported numerous organizations along this path.
source: Stefan Schaible, Global Managing Partner, on Edeltraud Leibrock appointment, Roland Berger Press Release, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Transforming from Europe-focused consultancy into a real global player driven by megatrends
question: Tell me about a time when you contributed to expanding or scaling an initiative beyond its original scope or geographic boundaries.
quote: Roland Berger grew from a Europe-focused consultancy into a real global player, driven by megatrends such as relocation of production, smart mobility, and sustainability that play to our strengths.
source: Stefan Schaible, Global Managing Partner, Roland Berger, 2024

role: Senior
principle_description: Achieving ambitious growth targets and exceeding financial milestones through strategic execution
question: Tell me about a time when you led efforts to exceed ambitious performance targets in a challenging environment.
quote: We expect to achieve our Strategy 2024 targets a year early and are fully on track to further accelerate our growth. In this fiscal year, we are again targeting double-digit growth and aim to exceed €1 billion in revenue for the first time.
source: Stefan Schaible, Global Managing Partner, Roland Berger, 2024

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Being yourself and revealing authentic leadership style to build team rapport and true followership
question: Tell me about a time when you had to be vulnerable or authentic with your team to build trust and achieve better results.
quote: Leaders need not know it all (they don't) and should reveal a more authentic CEO style (being yourself is good enough) to build team rapport and true followership: listen, reflect, communicate, share, and just be yourself.
source: Alex Liu, CEO and Managing Partner, World Economic Forum, 2022

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Finding first principles to create joy and purpose while maintaining healthy boundaries
question: Tell me about a time when you helped yourself or others find meaning and satisfaction in challenging work circumstances.
quote: You have to first self-define your own success. Then you can draw boundaries. You will have less mental health issues if you understand the difference between stress and boredom. You want to be challenged, you just don't want to be stressed.
source: Alex Liu, CEO and Managing Partner, World Economic Forum, 2022

role: Senior
principle_description: Unleashing renewable people energy as a leader's obligation to unlock human potential
question: Tell me about a time when you successfully motivated and energized a team that was underperforming or facing significant challenges.
quote: People energy is the most renewable energy resource and our obligation is to find ways to unleash that, to unlock that.
source: Alex Liu, CEO and Managing Partner, World Economic Forum, 2022

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Building trust through transparency and authentic communication to enable transformation
question: Tell me about a time when you had to build trust with stakeholders during a period of uncertainty or change.
quote: You can have a great strategy for transformation, but without the hearts and minds of your thousands of employees, it's not going to happen. In times where you have uncertainty and large transformation, authentic leadership is something there's a premium on these days.
source: Tim Ryan, Former PwC US Senior Partner, PwC Leadership Survey, 2024

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Taking measured risks while fostering creativity and entrepreneurial spirit at all levels
question: Tell me about a time when you took a calculated risk that others viewed as too bold or ambitious.
quote: Being bold may turn out to be the less risky approach. CEOs should foster creativity, entrepreneurial spirit and strategic thinking at all levels.

role: Senior
principle_description: Making bold informed decisions while balancing cost rationalization and business model reinvention
question: Tell me about a time when you led your organization through significant disruption while maintaining operational excellence.
quote: CEOs are balancing cost rationalization, business model reinvention and technology transformation to help their company thrive. Navigating disruption requires bold, informed action.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Being so extraordinary that clients have no choice but to work with you
question: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond to deliver exceptional results that exceeded expectations.
quote: You must be 'so extraordinary' that clients have no choice but to work with you. You have to be so much better than anyone else that they have no choice but to give it to you.
source: Julie Sweet, CEO, Accenture leadership interviews, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Leading through systems rather than command and control to achieve sustainable results
question: Tell me about a time when you influenced outcomes by building better processes or systems rather than relying on authority.
quote: CEOs cannot lead by command and control. You don't lead successfully because you can tell people what to do. A CEO of a large company needs systems that don't require them to dictate every move.
source: Julie Sweet, CEO, Axios interview, September 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Making deep learning a priority to achieve AI and transformation potential
question: Tell me about a time when you invested in developing deep expertise in a new area to lead your team through significant change.
quote: Leaders must make their own version of 'deep learning'—a phrase often applied to how AI processes data—a priority. Deep learning by humans is the key to achieving the potential, and that means leadership training.
source: Julie Sweet, CEO, TIME Davos interview, 2024Medtronic
column12: Using technology to improve human welfare by alleviating pain restoring health and extending life
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to balance technical innovation with patient impact, and how you ensured the human element remained central to your solution.
column16: Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 95,000+ passionate people across 150 countries
column17: Geoff Martha, CEO, Medtronic Annual Report, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Combining mission-driven purpose with performance accountability to achieve both patient outcomes and business results
question: Tell me about a time when you had to deliver strong business results while maintaining your commitment to a higher purpose or mission.
quote: We continue to be this mission-driven company that you know Medtronic to be and our customers and patients know Medtronic to be, but at the same time, performance driven. You've got to be both. It's not one without the other: no margin, no mission.

role: Senior
principle_description: Innovation depends on bringing diverse thinking and empowering every employee to reach their highest potential
question: Tell me about a time when you led an innovation initiative that required diverse perspectives, and how you ensured all team members could contribute meaningfully.
quote: At Medtronic, we believe that innovation is a people-powered business. Our ability to serve more patients is dependent on bringing diverse thinking to the table and empowering every employee to reach their highest potential.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Delivering transformative medical innovations that reach patients globally with measurable impact
question: Tell me about a time when you implemented a solution that had to scale globally while maintaining consistent quality and impact for end users.
quote: 95,000 employees deliver transformative medical innovations for over 70 conditions in the human body, reaching more than 78 million patients annually – that's two patients every second, every day.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Valuing collaboration over individual ego with focus on collective results and mutual support
question: Tell me about a time when you had to set aside your individual recognition to support team success, and how you handled that situation.
quote: The people that succeed at Stryker value each other, they play to their strengths, they care for each other, and they collaborate to win. People with high egos just don't do well at Stryker. We really focus on team-based results.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Innovation derived through close collaboration with clinical customers rather than isolated product development
question: Tell me about a time when you had to completely change your approach based on customer feedback, even when it meant scrapping significant prior work.
quote: Innovation can only be derived if you're very, very closely collaborating with customers… We don't want to invent anything without iteration with our clinical customers.
source: Kevin Lobo, CEO, Medical Design Interview, 2022

role: Senior
principle_description: Broadening focus from products to overall procedural efficacy customer experience and patient outcomes
question: Tell me about a time when you had to expand your project scope to consider the entire user experience rather than just the immediate deliverable.
quote: We're starting to broaden our lens from just looking at products to thinking about the overall procedural efficacy, to thinking about the customer experience and the patient experience.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Designing access and affordability into life-changing technologies from the first day of research and development
question: Tell me about a time when you had to design a solution that balanced quality and innovation with accessibility and cost considerations.
quote: Our goal is to improve the lives of 3 billion people by decade's end... That will require innovating for access and affordability from the first day of research and development.
source: Robert Ford, CEO, Abbott Sustainability Report, 2023

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Leveraging diverse healthcare portfolio across diagnostics medical devices nutritionals and medicines for sustained growth
question: Tell me about a time when you had to leverage different skill sets or resources across multiple areas to solve a complex problem.
quote: The strength and diversity of the Abbott portfolio drove our success in 2023
source: Robert Ford, CEO, Abbott Annual Report, 2023

role: Senior
principle_description: Using customer insights to develop treatment options that eliminate major surgery and create seamless personal technologies
question: Tell me about a time when you used deep customer insights to fundamentally reimagine how a process or service could be delivered.
quote: We're driving growth by remaining close to our customers and really listening to what they need for better care. Our insights-driven approach has resulted in treatment options that were never thought possible.
source: Robert Ford, CEO, Abbott Annual Report, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Maintaining continuous focus on talent culture and innovation to drive sustained growth
question: Tell me about a time when you had to continuously improve or innovate in your role rather than settling for 'good enough' results.
quote: As soon as you get settled on people and on innovation, then your growth slows, then you lay off people. So you have to be really restless on making sure you have great talent and culture and innovation.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Creating direct communication and reducing corporate bureaucracy to enable front-line innovation and agility
question: Tell me about a time when you had to cut through organizational barriers or bureaucracy to get something important accomplished.
quote: We actually thought of it as a startup: 'Let's create Boston Scientific.' Less corporate bureaucracy between him and the people leading operations on the front lines.

role: Senior
principle_description: Taking calculated risks on large innovations and acquisitions to compete with larger competitors and drive growth
question: Tell me about a time when you had to take a significant risk on an innovative approach because playing it safe wouldn't achieve your goals.
quote: If you're going to get that large, the size of some of our bigger competitors, you need big things to work, to grow faster. And oftentimes, you can't play it safe all the time with innovation M&A and win that way.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Focusing breakthrough products on transforming healthcare and improving patient health globally
question: Tell me about a time when you led a project that required balancing multiple stakeholder needs while keeping the end beneficiary as the primary focus.
quote: Boston Scientific is dedicated to transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients around the world.
source: Mike Mahoney, CEO, Corporate Mission Statement, 2023

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Adding gratitude as a guiding principle to show appreciation for every team member's contributions
question: Tell me about a time when you made sure to recognize and show gratitude for a colleague's contribution, especially when it might have gone unnoticed.
quote: Tornos recently added the concept of 'gratitude' to ZB's guiding principles to make sure they take the time to show gratitude to every team member.

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Empowering team members at every level to act as owners and operators while decentralizing decision-making for agility
question: Tell me about a time when you took ownership of a problem outside your direct responsibilities and how you approached solving it.
quote: To achieve Operational Excellence, team members act as owners and operators of the business. They decentralize decision-making to drive agility and empower team members at every level.

role: Senior
principle_description: Constantly looking for new ideas both inside and outside the organization rather than relying solely on internal R&D
question: Tell me about a time when you had to look beyond conventional sources to find a solution or opportunity for improvement.
quote: I'm proud of the work that we do via not just 'research and development', but also 'search and development.' We are constantly looking for new ideas inside and outside of Zimmer Biomet.

role: Leadership
principle_description: Prioritizing customer-centric care while recognizing patients as people who deserve enhanced quality of life
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision that prioritized long-term customer benefit over short-term convenience or profit.
quote: Our mission, to alleviate pain and improve the quality of life for people around the world, remains steadfast... We prioritize customer-centric care, recognizing that patients are people who deserve an enhanced quality of life.

role: Entry Level
principle_description: Putting patients at the center of everything to achieve remarkable outcomes and guide all decisions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to advocate for the end user's needs when others were focused on different priorities.
quote: By putting patients at the center of everything we do, we could achieve remarkable outcomes. This philosophy became the cornerstone of our company, guiding our decisions and actions.
source: Mike Mussallem, Former CEO, Leadership Interview, 2022

role: Mid Level
principle_description: Building relationships as trusted partners through integrity honesty openness and fairness
question: Tell me about a time when you had to maintain ethical standards or transparency in a challenging situation, even when it was difficult.
quote: The best way to ensure our ability to continue serving patients over the long term is by conducting our work with integrity, honesty, openness and fairness.
source: Mike Mussallem, Former CEO, Annual Report, 2022

role: Senior
principle_description: Having the toughness and courage to persist through challenges and setbacks to achieve breakthrough innovations
question: Tell me about a time when you faced significant setbacks or obstacles but had to persist because the goal was too important to abandon.
quote: You have to be tough enough and courageous enough to come in every day … and say, 'We're going to make this happen.'
source: Mike Mussallem, Former CEO, Leadership Profile, 2023

role: Leadership
principle_description: Developing life-saving innovations that transform patient care and create lasting global impact
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative that fundamentally changed how something was done and created lasting positive impact.
quote: Being able to replace a heart valve in under an hour all over the world and have great success with patients going home in a day or so, that's stunning. It's still mind-boggling to me.
source: Mike Mussallem, Former CEO, Industry Interview, 2023
